text: So I have returned to NMB several times since my review.  Things are getting better and I'm realizing that it's better to drink mediocre craft beer than drink mass produced beer found in most bars in Phoenix.   Was there over the weekend with other people that had been to NMB previously as well.  The pretzel bread is quickly turning into a favorite for all of us.    I've been to brew pubs all over the country and one thing that NMB needs to do is have 3-4 of their best beers on tap at all time.  Then rotate another 3 or so seasonal beers.  Couple of people in my group were hoping to grab a beer that wasn't on tap.   Also guessing that good help is hard to find.  On one trip to NMB I went right after work, which at most places is when it starts to get busy.  The bartender did check on all of us before taking off for 5 minutes for a smoke.  In those 5 minutes a few other people showed up to the bar and had to wait until the bartender came back.  If it's close to 6 PM your bar should be staffed.  Noticed that your employees like to use their cell phones while working.  Had to wait for another employee while they finished up a phone call.    But will keep going back, it's a nice little spot in a part of town that could use a good bar.

I really want to love this place, but I have had inconsistent experiences. Overall the place needs to find an identity. The food is good not amazing. Beers are very good and interesting, not your average brewpub brew. My biggest criticism would be the service and the pricing. Happy Hour, should be better in my opinion, and the quality of the food seems to have slid a bit since earlier in the restaurants life. I want to go again, they really seem to be trying.

Again I came and again I'm glad I did. There was live music and a ton of upbeat employees. We sat on the patio and it was perfect night for it, our waitress was so nice! We kept commenting on it during the night. I come from the customer service industry so when I go out i expect at least a smile and approachable attitude, this girl was all that and more! I didn't get her name but she had super straight teeth and tattoos? Lol I tried !
Good IPA, Tues nite music was cool, and food was good!

North Mountain Brewing is a cool addition to the neighborhood.  It's a little spartan inside, and can be a little loud too.  It's really ideal for a few beers with friends, and a light lunch or snack.  It's a lot like going over to your foodie friends house to hang out.  Try the cake - totally worth it.  Another stand out is the Justin salad.
Not the place to go if u want something quick to go. Staff is not real responsive and moves pretty slow. Hoping the food is good though
The Beers are excellent!  The food and service was good.  The neighborhood looked a bit sketchy but the parking lot and pub was nice.  All around very good
I am so disappointed by the food at this establishment. My husband and I both ordered the Sheperd's pie and it was bland. Definitely not worth the price of $12 a plate.

This establishment has the framework to be an AWESOME destination eatery/pub  What is needed: (just my little opinion)  1) Play up your selection of micro brews, take a tip from the micro beer pubs in San Diego. Have "beer menus" at each table and all over the place,.. write narratives on each brew, describe its flavor nuances, food pairings etc. And for the love of,... jump on the IPA train! Maybe you usually offer an IPA but not available when I stopped in, if you do,.. I suggest you make a BIG deal about it. (this is a deep pool, know whats out there before jumping in)  2) Have a "Service System",.. your wait staff seems distracted, inattentive, uninformed about what they offer, and generally confused. (as in not knowing what to do next)  Again, borrowing from other successful operations devise a "system" that is centered around what the customer experience is from the time they walk through the door until they wave goodbye. Train your staff to follow the system for each customer. I really believe you can close your gaps in service this way. This is not an easy thing to do but I believe it is critical to the business.  Reviews that are wishy washy and offer no help are useless to me (as a consumer) I hope you feel the same as an operator. That said,.. my review for the masses is below:  Good food, Good Ambiance, sketchy service and Great beer. You should go, support the effort here and be on the team to build this good place into a great place.
Good service and food. The food is high-end for a brew pub, definitely not the same frozen stuff you find everywhere. That makes the prices a little high, but not crazy.

Tucked away where Cave Creek, Dunlap, and 7th Street meet, North Mountain Brewing is a jewel in the rough. The live music can be a bit loud and you might make some new friends (lots of six-top table options, few two/four-tops), but solid beers and a varied (almost eclectic) menu will keep us coming back.

My review is what it is.   The beer itself can carry the establishment. All of the styles were one point.   The food...Eh. My feeling is they should scale the menu down too the items that they do best. The crab dip that we ordered tonight had very little crab in it and had pita strips that barely were able to pick up the dip. They did eventually bring bigger, wider strips, but our feeing was that it should have been part of their QC process.   I then ordered the shepherds pie. It wasn't cold, but it wasn't exactly warm either. I could have made this in my own kitchen. Any colder and I would have sent it back, but I had waited nearly a half an hour for t and was hungry.   Erica was our waitress and helped us anyway that she could. Unfortunately, this place is not the total package. While the beers are spot on, the food not so much. North Mountain Brewing Co. would have been better off opening just a tap room, rather than  full scale brew pub.   The Red is smooth, the blonde is great, but it eventually needs to lead to somewhere and it didn't for me tonight.

Lunch was amazing! I highly recommend the Grilled Cheese w/ Bacon. It was excellent. This meal comes with soup so I had the Chicken Tortilla Soup which is also very good. My sister ordered the Fish & Chips and says it was great. Overall, food was excellent.   My parents say that the beer's good. My dad's favorite was the Barrio Aged CardinAle Red. My mom liked the Octomalt-Hybrid-Imperial Red/ IPA. Experience was excellent.

Aggressive staff upon walking in.  The bar was full so we hesitated where we wanted to sit.  We were show to a seat under the tv and the speakers for music.  We were asked twice if we wanted to eat and responded both times with "no, not right now" to the dismay of the server.   Servers didn't seem too happy.  No smiles or happy attitudes.  Perhaps this was b/c we didn't sit at the bar and were at the table which implies we want food yet the bar was full.  Beautiful graphics and logos.  Beer was just ok.  Food choices looked interesting but not a place I wanted to hang out.
LOVE this place! Great food & beer! The staff is friendly & welcoming! If you are looking for a chill spot... This is it! I recommend the crab dip & Brussels sprout salad! :)
Delicious food, great craft beers, and fantastic service. We will be back here whenever we are in the area. The brussels sprouts salad was fantastic, just the right amount of heat!

Shepherds pie, Fried Shrimp, Fried Chicken Sandwich.....*Hands down-Thumbs Up* one of the best meals I've ever had!  BRAVO Super CHEF  Clayton Howells!!!   I was so focused on eating and distracted by the level of quality that taking pictures just wasn't even a thought!

On our never-ending quest to find the best microbrew, we visited on a Saturday afternoon, not too busy, though the parking lot was pretty full. There's a patio facing Dunlap, but we sat inside, nice d√©cor, bright, airy, inviting lots of TV's for the sports lover. We got the 8 flight, the best were N'eurotic Belgium Ale, a little sweet but packs a punch with 10.4%; The Barrel Aged Octomalt, my fave, was so complex, the rum barrel aging definitely adding another dimension to the regular Octomalt brew. The James Brown Imperial Soul, a stout that was smooth and no bitterness whatsoever. We liked Groovin with a Pict, a Scottish ale,  but it can't compare to our favorite, the Scootcher from Sleepy Dog Brewery in Tempe. We could fill a growler $12-$14 but not with any that we really wanted (N'eurotic, barrel Octomalt, James Brown), so we decided not to. They also have an extensive food menu. I chose the Poutine, french fries covered in a rich brown gravy, awesome ale braised short ribs, and topped with cheese curds, so decadent that I had to share. Good thing, because the hubby chose fish and chips, 3 fresh tasting, beer battered pieces with shoestring fries that was a little lacking in portion size for $12. Add another portion or make the ones you serve bigger, please! Will we come again? Yes, and we will be bringing our friends, too.

Love NMB! Delicious beers and always more than a few on tap I love. Food is killer and staff is super friendly/warm. Come here often and will continue to! $4 happy hour beers that are delish plus stuffed mushrooms/great burger deals....plus legitimately the best pork tacos on taco Tuesday. Do it...you need to!!!

I'll start with the pros: The restaurant was immaculately clean as well as the restrooms.  And has a great ambiance.   Everything seems pretty mediocre. They had 4 of their own beers plus one guest tap. Their beers were nothing special. The pale ale, Patrick star and ipa were all very similar. The stout seems more like a porter in my opinion (I love both styles so I did enjoy it).  The menu is a miss match of a worldly items and doesn't have any real flow to it. The food was fresh and well presented. The fries that come with the fish and chips are different fries that come with the poutine and were both disappointing. The fish was great as well as the small portion of short ribs on the poutine.  Everyone I was with complained about the portion for the price. But fresh ingredients are more expensive than a bunch of frozen crap. So I didn't mind the prices, I actually thought they weren't bad.   The cons: Service. The service was horrible. Since we were nearly the only ones there we got our food quickly and our first round of beers came out quickly, although my wife was never asked what she wanted to drink so she never got anything. We were never offered another round of drinks, only dessert. Our server never came back to check on us either and we didn't see her for some time. When we left there was a group of about 6 or 7 employees all smoking in the back parking lot at their smoking area. Guess smoking is a higher priority than a paying customer.

This was my first visit to North Mountain Brewery. I tried their Creem IPA which I really enjoyed, well as their loaded macaroni and cheese. The atmosphere was very relaxed and I would definitely go back again. I would like to try some of their other IPA beers and food.

Been there several times.   Greeted warmly and seated promptly.  Servers took orders quickly and knew the menu well.   Specials were related and all questions answered.  Food served in a timely fashion and it was delicious.   House wine was good and a great value.   My beer snob friends approved of the beer selections and prices.  Service seems to be better than most restaurants.   I will be back frequently.

Had an absolutely horrible experience here today. Burger ordered outside was raw in the center. Bought tickets for food and drinks and were told we could use them in the restaurant. Inside, the crab dip very small even though the menu said it was enough for 2. When we asked our server Jessica about it, she told us that everything was pre- portioned and oh well. When paying the tab, server told us that we could not use our tickets on the restaurant tab. Isn't the money all going to the same place? The brewery? The server told us that the owner said we could return our tickets for our cash back at the tent. When returning the tickets at the tent we received a lot of attitude from the man working there. A lady who was also also at the tent, piped up with "oh...you're the lady who returned the burger". Yes ma'am, the raw burger. Will never return after the shitty customer service. I'll warn others as well.

Ok 2nd time here and i feel compelled to talk about the food. Ordered the nachos and was not impressed. First of all they put a big dollop of sour cream on top (guess that wasn't optional). Then i got to the next level which was cheese (or perhaps it's distant cousin). Tasted like cheese whizz. Not impressed .....stick to beer please

This is the type of Public house every neighborhood needs. We just stopped in for a beer and a snack. We found an atmosphere that is inviting, open and kind of quirky. A nice selection of beers that include not only their own kettle creations but well thought out Local (Guest) tap offerings.  For my kindred spirits that enjoy a little bread to go with their beer I must recommend the pretzel, they where fantastic with the ESB. We also tried the wings and I will tell you they are not from Buffalo. They are marinated, grilled, tender and the most refreshing flavor I have sampled on chicken in a long time.

Ordered the crab dip, was a thin soupy mess, our server was either brand new or just didn't want to be here that night, kids meals came out about 25 min after our order, was Mac and cheese and a kids burger. Noodles completely mush! Then a outer 10-15 min later my wife's "steak" sandwich and my sausage platter came out. Sausage was the worst presentation of a meal pretty much anywhere. Some lumpy like warm mashed potatoes with??? You guessed it like warm sausage. A couple mixed peppers on top. My wife sandwich was at best a 1.5 out of 10. Then of course cause it's a "Brewery" our bill was 56 bucks, and we had waters no beer or anything else to drink. I would rather pay $10 for a Big Mac and throw it in he toilet that eat at North Mountain again! And the hostess on the way out was too busy on her phone, start to finish from the service to the food was poor!

Excellent! We groaned with delight over every dish. The crab dip, mussels, mac and cheese and sausage platter were yummy. We also had the hefe, dog bollacks?, red ale and caber toss. All excellent beers. I do some home brewing, so after I asked, they gave us a free brewery tour. Very interesting. The food is much better than any east side brewery I have been too.

Just tried this place great IPAs if you are an IPA lover. We only tried a couple appetizers they were very good but I really like the menu will definitely go back and try an entr√©e really like the place it was cool had a casual vibe family-friendly

I'm a big fan of North Mountain. It's probably my favorite place to have a beer in the valley. I'm repeatedly disappointed by 4 Peaks, Ohso, the Yard, and many others that are trying so hard. This reminds me of my favorite small breweries and beer houses in Germany and my favorite neighborhood place down the street from where I used to live in North Portland. The food is good, I love the kale salad (huge), and the poutine is decadent and amazing. The beers are great, I love the red and there's a great American pale on occasionally too. I highly recommend North Mountain.

Ok, I want to give this place 3 stars, but its new, so I grade on a curve.  Food... - YOU NEED MORE SANDWICHES/COMFORT FOOD...  try to bring a pulled pork sandwich or a reuben on  your menu...  The night we went, around 8pm on a thursday, it was busy, parking was pretty full.   The hostess was friendly, up beat... The atmosphere was cool... though I was blinded by the bright lighting inside the restaurant, which for me, is offputting.  We opted to sit outside, which was nice.    The female server, mid thirtys, very nice, tattoos i think, was a sweetheart... However she didnt mention what they were out of, until after our drink orders were delivered...  THEY WERE OUT OF THE BURGER! the only sandwich on the menu... I opted to try the pretzels, and the chicken wings.  My friend got the shepherds pie and the poutine.  We gave the POUTINE  5 stars! great dish! pretzel bites - 4 Stars - tasty sauces CHICK WINGS 4 STARS... - very spicy, a tad over cooked, Shephards pie - 3 stars..  not bad. Beer - very tasty 5 Stars...  I love oysters, but I don't think of them as going with beer, maybe thats just me... I usually would want a martini or a glass of champagne.  Message to the owner : Keep it up! lower the lights! and get a few more sandwiches, you will be rolling in the dough!

Being medically required to ride the wagon currently, I was there for the food - and it was worth the trip.   First off, they have lumpia, which I've mot found elsewhere in the Valley. When I lived in the SF Bay Area, my next-door neighbor for several years was the local 'queen' of the Pilipina community, and these were her specialty for every street festival, fair, and celebration. NMB's are almost as good as hers, which means they are excellent - and the portion is very generous as well. The two sauces that accompany them are both delicious, but I think I like the peanutty one best.   Highlighting an unjustly maligned vegetable, the Brussels Sprout salad is a very tasty presentation of an off-beat dish. Nicely spiced, the tiny leaves have been stir-fried, I think, and are wonderfully accented by the peppers and other accouterments. The dressing was good, but here's a tip - use the leftover lumpia sauce(s), either ot both, for an added taste treat.   My companion thoroughly enjoyed his Grilled Cheese sandwich - he had decided to forego accompanying it with the Tomato Soup, so he was able to help me polish off the lumpia, which he loved. He enjoyed his chosen libation, too - I was trying to ignore it, out of jealousy. The baseball playoffs were on, so he was happy about that, too.  Other family members are practically regulars here, so I'm sure to be back soon - I look forward to a return trip.  (Just one caveat - the servers who smoke need a better understabding of how far they are supposed to be from the entrance.)

A close, casual spot. The service is genuine and helpful. My experiences here have always been more than satisfactory. The food is good, not amazing, but good and worth the price. The beer is great, I'd recommend any of their higher ibu or darker beers. If you're a fan of Belgians they have a good option for you. This is one of those restaurants that I could frequent due to the close proximity of my residence.

We love it here! This was our second visit! The staff is friendly and the food and suds are super. We discovered North Mountain Brewing Company when the owner/brew master presented a Science and History of Beer for AZ SciFest. Personable service, great food, and terrific beer! They are family friendly. Patrons include couples, groups, families, sports fans (multiple big screens), retirees, college age, and everything in between!

Had heard good things about the food here, so I went to fill a growler on Saturday.  After standing at the bar for a bit without any assistance, I asked one of the 4 waitstaff sitting around a table folding napkins and they told me to go back to the bar.  After waiting another 5 minutes without any help from the bartender, I left.  Too bad there are so many employees, but no one to help.  Explains why the place was empty on a Saturday!

Just found out that NMB changed the formula for the Dirty Blonde and the name as well! So sad. Still, the Kaiserlich Dunkle Weiss, Cardin Ale Red, and Mild Child are thoroughly enjoyable.   And of course, the food is always good. I still love the grilled cheese and am always happy with the appetizers- especially the crab dip.  An Oktoberfest beer is coming- a perfect alternative to the pumpkin mania taking over. ;)

Okay, it's been a week or so since the opening day for North Mountain Brewery.  Cut some slack for opening weekend issues and look at what NMB offers our area.  The food is top notch!  Beers are awesome and keep coming out of the brewery with all the freshness and unique flavor anyone can ask for from local microbrews.  We have been back three times and each visit gets better and better.  This Microbrewery is on track to really make a name for itself in the Phoenix culinary arena.  Not pretentious or fake. Real solid brews and a menu to be proud of.  Kudos to everyone at NMB!
So far, I learned to STAY AWAY from the nachos. All of the chips were soggy, they were cold, and covered in cheese wiz like sauce. Absolutely disgusting
Food has gone down hill fast. No flagship beers and not always looking to experiment with new beer styles. Service slow and servers same unhappy.

A great little local brewery and restaurant! The beer is always good, and the food is really delicious. Try the poutine! They offer brunch on Sundays, and everything tastes really good.   My only mark down is that sometimes service can be a little slow, but otherwise it's a favorite place of mine that I will definitely recommend to others!

Ate here several weeks ago and it was a pleasant surprise. The staff was great! The atmosphere was charged and everybody was looking like they were having a great time..The beers were fantastic and they do flights which I recommend. The food is definitely worth a repeat visit from me and look forward to visiting this establishment again. It was a very enjoyable experience and if you find yourself on this side of town it's a must see.

This is more of a 3.5 for me at this point, but could bump it up in the future. I've been coming here on Tuesday nights which is open mic night. The service is friendly and there are a surprising number of people there for a Tuesday night. Kind of an older crowd. Most of the bands play classic rock, which I can get into. So the open mic night is fun and adds to the atmosphere so that is more of the 4-star-I'm-a-fan category, and I'd like to see what the place is like on the weekend too, so I'll be back. And it's a unique bar and hangout for the neighborhood so it gets points there.  The beer and food is more in the 3-star-A-OK category. I've tried a few different beers and all were pretty good but nothing to write home about. Their beers can't compete with the other more established local breweries like Four Peaks or San Tan, at least not yet. North Mountain seems to rotate out their beers so I could see them eventually brewing up a beer that become their signature just like Kiltlifter is for Four Peaks.   I only got food this last time I was there. I had a grilled chicken sandwich. As my friends even pointed out, the chicken breast on my sandwich was quite small. The chipotle mayo didn't have much of a kick, and I could have done without the bacon jam. I had overlooked the jam when I ordered the sandwich so next time I'll know to ask them to hold that, but I don't really get that condiment when you already have chipotle mayo. And if you want bacon, then you can just order actual bacon and not bacon in jam form, amirght? All that aside it really wasn't a bad grilled chix, and I will add that my friend liked her french onion soup very much.

Gave this spot a second chance after visiting right after their grand opening.  Sat at the bar and found it was dirty, very average food and the waitress acted like she was doing us a huge favor.  Try harder people!  We need better restaurants in north Phoenix.  Lots of opportunities to improve.

I made reservations for 32 people and Candy and the crew at North Mountain Brewery were fantastic. Everybody loved their beer, their food, and the atmosphere. We even had a few crazy kids running around (as kids do), and that staff never gave us any dirty looks; just friendly service. Very family friendly.

Stopped by on a Sunday afternoon and the live music was a bonus!   The Funk 49 beer was light and delicious! The food.... YUM on absolutely EVERYTHING we ordered!!!    Lumpia... Basically an egg roll with spicy peanut sauce.  Delicious !!! Crab dip... Again,  yummy!!! Loaded Mac and cheese..  OMG !!!!! But the dessert......" Piece of cake".... SAVE ROOM!  It was fantastic! This will become a new favorite place!

Ive been here quite a few times...... Today was last time..... Seated myself..... Bar was full...... Ok... But I sat there for 10-12  minutes.... 5 feet away from where servers we bringing out orders and no one even approached me to even give a menu or say "be with you shortly" ...... Terrible!  I was in plain view...... Sorry to see such pathetic service in what is normally a good place

North Mtn Brewery is a fun local brewery with a great selection of beer to choose from.  The staff is friendly and always willing to let you sample some beer to try.  Dropped stars because a friend and I ordered a side of brussel sprouts and a side of cauliflower ($7.00 each).  The side of roasted cauliflower came in a small bowl and was probably a total of 6 medium florets. For seven dollars....  the roasted brussel sprouts were a little more jazzed up but still small.  I get the side component would be smaller, however, for what was served was way too expensive.  Otherwise, great place to pop by for a local beer.

Great place to see life entertainment in the North Phoenix area!  The musicians were fabulous and so was the food.  I never had Brussels sprouts and thought I would have hated them. I can't wait to go back and have them again!

Excellent service! Bartender (Anthony) was both friendly and very knowledgable about the beer and brewing process.  Food was excellent! I had Kobe beef burger...delicious!  Nice neighborhood bar!  We will be back! Thank you north mountain brewing for giving us our new favorite place to go!!!

Excellent atmosphere and great brew.  Our server Erica was excellent and very friendly. She gave us great suggestions and seemed knowledgeable about the beers. The owner of the brewery showed us on a quick tour and was one of the friendliest people I've met in Arizona.  If you're around in this area, I'd definitely recommend this brewery.

Tried to check this place out.  My bad, showed up at 3:30 and they dont open until 4.  All good - strange thing, dude in brewery t-shirt out front sweeping up the place (not a kitchen worker - seemed like an owner or manager) just looked at us.  Did not even say hello or , "thanks for stopping come back at 4.". Didn't really seem to give a sh** about our business or NO business.  So 4 Peaks welcomed up with smiles and thanks for our hard earned $'s.  save your time, attitude seems to go in line with many of the other reviews. Just because you can craft a beer does not mean you have the talent , personality or professionalism to open an establishment for patrons!  Go to Phoenix Brewing anda say hi to Fretzy and the team or  faithful standby 4 Peaks or the many other good brewers and restaurant owners that DO appreciate you.

Ive been driving by this place for the longest time but tonight was the night. I ordered some food to go n enjoyed a delicious beer while my order was up. The beer octomalt  (amazing! ) the food a southwest burger, pretzel n cheese, and meat pizaa (amazing!). I will definitely be coming back.

My fiance and I just attended a food/beer pairing event last night - it was EXCELLENT. There were 8 courses, including 8 beers and 8 different dishes, each with a personal story and description from the brewmaster and head chef in person, who were both funny and interesting. We had a private room with about 20 people and it was a very well-organized, delicious, comfortable experience and we can't wait to go back to NMBC for more beer and food during its regular hours!

Kayla was great as our server. The pizza was great. Salad was fresh. Wish they offered a IPA that was not a double or imperial. Otherwise we love this place. Would recommend it for an enjoyable experience.

Let me first say I wish I could award 3.5 stars.  NMBco has a lot going for it.  1) The neighborhood - There isn't a ton of competition in this area of town and it is awesome to have a micro brewery this close to where I love. 2) Good quality beer 3) Live music 4) Very nice wait staff 5) The place is bright and clean  It is lacking in a couple areas though...  1) While the quality of the beer is good, I just didn't get the flavor complexity I wanted.  Don't get me wrong I enjoyed the beer, but is NMBco is going to compete with the other local heavy hitters on taste, they will need tweak their beers just a little. 2) I didn't try a lot of food but the food wasn't terribly great even by pub standards.  Make a good burger, make good fish and chips, and have a really solid pretzel...   If you have to go out with friends and don't feel like going to Sun Up, Four Peaks, Papago, etc.. this is a solid alternative.  Me?  I will just go buy some good bottle and hang out on my porch with friends, did I mention that Sprout's carries Dogfish Head bears now?  That's an IPA i can get behind!

Seems every time I find a place that is good I go back and I go back again and then I get the food to go and they fail once and I try another time and they fail again. I'm sad cuz I like their food but if you can't get deep frying 101 right...smh the French fries were so full of grease they were limp and there was a puddle of grease next to the fries. The battered cod was also soaked in grease I couldn't eat it. $$ down the disposal. Obviously the grease was not hot enough. Seriously considering not ever going back and continue looking for other places in Sunnyslope, my new hood.

New place with growing pains.  Owner has a passion for beer, so wish him well.  Tyson the bartender Alzheimer's is worse than my 90 year grandfathers.  Reminded him several times for a pint and he still forgot.  The "James brown" beer is too blah for my taste, below average brown. The stout was great and the ESB is average.   Menu is small which is a plus.

Last night was my first visit to North Mountain Brewery in phoenix. It was well worth a trip from the west valley. I usually try my best to seek out craft breweries, but most times I will settle for a descent pub here and there. Ok, first thing is first, the parking lot is located in the BACK of the brewery. I saw the front patio from Dunlap, but still had to search for the parking lot lol.   The atmosphere first walking in was a neighborhood bar type of mood, so that's always really welcoming. Pretty good size bar with all the brews right there on tap, and behind the bar is the brewery for you too easily see and watch some new brews being created. I had two pints and chowed down on something on the menu called the loaded macaroni and cheese. The first beer was the PT42 Red Ale, I thought it tasted great. Beer number two was the Hoy!, I.P.A., always and I.P.A. everybody, if you are going to head to any brewery you gotta at least try their I.P.A. It is freakin' awesome!!! Really good and hoppy, which means full of flavor to the very last gulp.  Ok my areas I of concern was first the easy to miss parking lot, and maybe an open for business could help a little too. The door to the bar had it's hours printed on a sheet of paper and scotch taped to the window. If you choose to sit at the bar be prepared for ALOT of kitchen noise, space is somewhat limited so you will hear and see every single kitchen noise and food creation because there is no wall dividing the two. Still it's a loacl brew so gotta give credit where credit is due.
Great place. We enjoyed this brew pub. The beer was great. The food was awesome. And the service was great.

The micro brew beers are fantastic, but the food is surprisingly amazing as well. Many spots that make their own beer focus primarily on a great brew, but these guys could stand alone on the food. The chicken sandwich is "out of this world" delicious. It is lightly breaded with a thin coat of some wonderful spread called bacon jam. The name sounds funny but that stuff is the perfect compliment to the chicken. It is impressive to discover a restaurant that can produce food and drink in the same manner that Chopin produced music.  The arrangement of the tables could use an overhaul. Group seating and 6 tops are not the way that most patrons want to dine.  The food quality does over shadow the funny seating configuration. Tables can be changed.

My husband and I had lunch there today and we were both very happy with the food and the service. Our server was very attentive to us.  I had the blackened chicken sandwich which was very good.  My husband had the cheeseburger.  Though slightly small it was very moist and flavorful and prepared just as he ordered.  We both enjoyed  the french fries that came with the sandwich and also the beers we selected.  We will be returning.

A jewel to be found in Paradise Valley. I'm visiting Arizona to assist a relative and had the opportunity to be in this area and stopped in, what a find. Have been drinking craft beer for more than 20 years. We live in the Bay Area and have had the chance to try many craft breweries, this is possibility the finest brews I've tried, their C.R.E.E.M. Ale was killer. I must say the brew master is an artist and knows his craft. This place is worth the visit if you enjoy good brew, did not eat but if the beer is an indication of quality I would guess the food is good. A must visit place not far off of the highway if you enjoy BEER.  Note I am not a yelper but just had too on this one, it is must place to visit if your in the area or even a drive just to go.   Kerry

Friendly staff, happy people, nice & clean place, smoking area is also cool, parking is easily accessible. The best beer i ever had, try their mother of beer! And food is so delicious, they took care of everything. Prices are okay, me & my friend each one had hefe beer and mother of beer, we both shared the fish & chips plate -it's a big plate- as well as the kale salad -vegetables mix, so tasty!- .. That was all for 40 something $$ ..  Good for groups, good for couples. I spent this night there and it was very fun time & I'm totally willing to go back..  Have fun people!

Great local craft brewery with surprisingly good food. We came here with a large group to watch a world cup match. Our server bent over backwards to make sure we had a great experience, which we did. Beer was great. Caber Toss Scottish was my favorite. Followed by the C.R.E.E.M ale. Food-wise, the shepherd's pie was delicious. Had the poutine, too, but would opt for the shepherd's pie over that when we come again. Great neighborhood bar.

One star because "no stars" is not an option.  This is the exact email I sent to the brewery after leaving this establishment about my "experience" which has yet to be acknowledged :  Pretty disappointed by last night's experience. Or lack there of. We got to the brewery a few minutes before what I was told was our "reservation" time and just shortly after a party of 4 had gotten there. I heard the host tell the party that since they did not have a ''reservation", it would be about a 30-40 minute wait. The party moved aside to discuss if they wanted to wait or not. The host then ignored my husband and I for 5 minutes while she conversed with 3 other employees all who seemed to not have a care in the world. When we finally got her attention she found our name on the "reservation" list and informed us it would still be at least 30/45 minutes before we could be sat. Now longer than the group who walked in before us that didn't have a "reservation". We have no problem over looking minor service issues,especially at a new place, when dining out, but when it comes at the expense of wasting our entire evening, that's just inexcusable. Why bother taking reservations? Scratch that, why email me and ask me if I'd like to have a reservation for your establishment if you have no intention of honoring it. Sure you maybe thinking, "we were going to honor it, just 45 minutes late"... Which means it would take me how long to get food and beer after arriving at this imaginary table? Also 30/45 minutes? Lame.   So I have yet to get a response...  Forget this small place with crap parking. Go to Fate, or Angels Trumpet, or Sun Up, or Phoenix Ale House, or Sleepy Dog, or Four Peaks, or Gordon Biersch, or hell, drive the hour to Sedona or Pine and visit one of their many breweries. All of them will be more than happy to provide you with wonderful beer & food with out a "reservation"... Just don't bother here.

Excellent beer and food, but service could use improvement. Two different visits yielded day and night waitstaff experiences so it seems more training is in need for more attentive quality and consistency.

The atmosphere and service were good.  Out of tasting 7 beers of a flight,  I liked the cream ale and the oatmeal stout. All the other beers were okay but, not really enough flavor to differentiate one from the other. They didn't have the porter on tap, which I was looking forward to trying. I don't know if it was a bad day or I chose the wrong meal but I ordered the small roasted vegetable Flatbread pizza, it had no sauce, was dry,  overcooked. All the awesome veggies listed looked like diced peppers. It was not restaurant worthy. Totinos one dollar grocery store pizza was better. The place has potential with a little work. Not worst place ever but disappointing.

Meh. Bartender is the only reason to come here. She's super friendly and accommodating. I came in here with one purpose. I was informed that 1. They don't support other local breweries and 2. Their employees go out and demand a discount cause they work here. Both are true. It's a community, get over yourself. It's not that great of a product. Will not return.

What a great place! Great food, great brews, awesome atmosphere. Come as you are, a true brewery. It is noisy... So be ready to raise the volume for your conversations, but the noise makes it good for kids as they won't be bothering others. Friendly service... Make a trip here when you get the chance.
Simply AWESOME place. Owners Candy and Rob are very special people who have created a wonderfully special place in Sunnyslope. Be sure to try their C.R.E.E.M. beer - absolutely over the top!

Went to soft opening and had a blast, and couldn't wait to go back!  Went back a month or so later and took a great friend with me. The beer was VERY good (and the ONLY reason this is 3 stars) but the food was worse! Burger came back WAY over cooked and the size of a sausage patty at $14??? Told the waitress about it and she seemed to be oblivious that I wasn't happy and never brought me another burger, so the manager took care of me. Won't be going for the food, and the service was a joke. Stinks, really good beer, so maybe I will go back, but just for the beer. : P
Just wanted to say that we have been back since & the service has improved a lot. The beer is delicious, the food is great, and they have tons of TVs! Great for games & music!   Thanks!

We liked it. We had a good experience. Parking was fun, we drove past and could have sworn that this place was closed untill we found the parking and entrance in the back.  The vibe in cool, liked the long tables and benches, if we lived locally I am sure we would be regulars.   I am unfortunalty not a huge beer fan, my partner is. So secondhandly I give a thumbs up to the beer. The crab dip was on point. The chicken sandwhich was okay. I am sure if we return to Phoenix again we will stop here again.

My husband and I love NM Brewing.  It is a great place to chill over some great craft beer and good food. They have the best brussels sprouts side and also roasted cauliflower.  Fish and chips are good as well as Poutine.  Burgers are tasty as well as the steak sandwich.  My husband likes the Shepherd's Pie.  Really I have never had any bad food here.  It's not fine dining but great casual dining that pairs well with the beer.  Their beer menu changes and they are great about giving you a shot glass sample before you choose.  Love the CardinAle -- my go to - while my husband gravitates to either the Pict or the Octomalt.  This is just a family owned casual low-key place.  If you are looking for trendy or creativity this is not your place.  For me it is just right and the reason why we keep coming back!

Had heard about this place from a few friends. Decided to give it a try. Overall, our experience was very good.  Started out with a couple of beers. We opted for, sorry can't remember the name, a fruit flavored summer brew. LIght, but refreshing. For dinner we split the fish and chips and an eggplant pizza. I think the fish and chips were better than the pizza, but both were good.  Overall, I was surprised at how nice the place is. Seems like this area needed a good place.

The food and staff are fantastic. Good fresh beer but a bit Meh. Nothing too special about the beer but the food and friendly staff makes up for it. Was better when they had open mic night. Turning a bit too hipster for me. Crowded and far too loud with the band's they book. Screaming at the person sitting next to you suxxx.

We have been to North Mountain a handful of times, the first being the week they opened.  They had the standard "just opened" restaurant issues but the beer was good.   A few weeks ago we went and the beer selection was limited- they were out of  some of their beers.  The beer they did have was just OK.  I get that beer takes time and maybe they are still trying to judge volume, but the quality of beer has also gone down hill.   Wanting to really like this place and support business in our neighborhood, we tried it again last night.  Beer is notably worse and they have updated the menus to try and explain why there is an inconsistency and call it "rotating taps".  What I got out of this was, "we can't figure out how to make our beers (listed on the menu) consistently so we will pour whatever comes out of the batch."    We have not tried much of the food menu.  But this is a brewery, the beer should be the focus, right?  Oh, forgot to mention our server last night.  She disappeared and we had to go to the bar to get our check.  Luckily one of the servers sitting at the bar knew her employee ID and could print it for us.  They couldn't find her either.
Good food, good beer, be patient ,be prepared to wait, good live music makes the wait tolerable.

I have been going to North Mountain for over a year now! I have found Heroes 19 there (the beer to honor the Yarnell Firefighters), and tons of other delicious beers. Current favorite is the Serendipitous! I do wish they would bring back the Bearded Dragon and the Imaginary IPA.  The bartenders and servers have never been anything but the friendliest, and even if I go by myself I always find myself caught up in a nice conversation.   Oh yeah, they have some of the best wings I have ever had! Without hyperbole!  I wish them nothing but the best!

Right on good spot with great beer and good food.  The menu could use an update, but what they serve is top notch.  Their wings may be the best made.  Who knew Sunnyslope could be so trendy and taste so good.

I went here for the first time on Friday night. Now, I do not drink beer, I hate beer BUT all of my friends drink it so I goto breweries for support. I was impressed with NMBC, the interior was awesome, I loved seeing the stills and the whole rear wall is doors that open to a patio that were open. Our waiter was kick ass and was the epitome of customer service. There was some great live music going on and it wasn't some horrible hipsters. Now, as I said, I do not drink beer so I had a coke. It took me awhile to read the menu to decide what to eat, everyone raved about the crab dip and said the chicken sandwich and burgers were not worth eating. I decoded to get the all-meat 7" pizza and damnit, that was a FANTASTIC choice. Though I do not drink beer, I will come back for the atmosphere and the pizza. I gave 5 stars for the pizza.
The beer and food were both amazing! It's not convenient for me but if I ever find myself near here I'll be sure to stop back in for a pint and an app.
Really good food. Table ordered Shepard's pie, Burger, steak sandwich, and fish and chips. Food came out fast and delicious. My only negative, don't order the sangria, they don't know how to make it.
My new favorite brewery. Had a great Hefe and their food was awesome. BBQ pork sliders were the best I've ever had.

If you like good food and great beer, try this spot; you won't regret it.  This has become a must visit for me every time I'm out here in AZ.  Right now I'm having the Purplesaurus after killing a pastrami sandwich. Recently, I took a growler of their guava beer back home to CA and everyone liked it. Everything here is just good...trust me.

Recently attended a food/beer pairing event - one of the very best dinner experiences I have EVER had. The brewmaster and head chef visited us before all 8 of the courses, explaining what they had made and why they were pairing them together. It was so personal and thoughtful, and unique and entertaining. Absolutely wonderful event, and we can't wait to go back to NMBC for more beer and food during regular hours!

Went there with my husband, kids & dog. Service was ok. The kitchen was backed up due to s large party. They were seating people and telling them they could order drinks, no food orders for 20 minutes. The German pretzel appetizer was good. You can order cheese for an additional $1 which we didn't NOT ask for and the waitress gave us and charged us a $1 for, so I deducted a $1 from her tip. I got the Chicken Fundido sandwich which was pretty good, nothing I have to go back & have again though. My husband had the burger with pulled pork on it and said it was below average. I did try the Mead flight and the first 2 were good, the last two...yuck! The outdoor patio is quite small & had poor lighting. It was very hard to see. Overall dining experience was just ok and nothing made me have to go back.

Great beer, great food, great atmosphere.  Have been here multiple times and it always delivers. The beers are always amazing and the food is the best!! Would highly recommend visiting here. Try the poutine!

Atmosphere: A-  I was pleasantly surprised when I walked into North Mountain Brewing Company. When I say pleasantly surprised, I don't mean it in a bad way at all - it's just that the surrounding area could be seen by some as being a bit rough. North Mountain felt very homey to me right away - they were blasting reggae (which is the way to my heart), they had two long communal tables, lighting was nice, and they also had just enough Christmas decorations to feel festive. I loved it. They do a great job of making themselves seem like an oasis in the area they are in. Even though my stop there was relatively quick, it's a place I can see myself just hanging at for hours at a time.  Cleanliness: A  A very clean place. Always a good feeling to have. Sometimes it can be tough for an establishment to feel homey and clean at the same time, but North Mountain did it.  Service: B+  Service was great. When we walked in, a bartender immediately noticed and greeted us, informing myself and my fiance that we could take a seat anywhere and a server would find us. I can't recall our server's name, but she was very attentive and got the timing down very well on when we needed checking up on. My only complaint (if that) on service was when I asked what her favorite beers were on the menu, she simply pointed out two that were the most popular. Most of the time when I ask a server or bartender for a recommendation, I expect a somewhat passionate response as to what they personally enjoy eating/drinking. I didn't get that here.  Food: B-  A first glance the menu seemed to be a bit boring. After a closer look, I did notice they offer a few good spins to traditional bar/brewery food which is nice. We ordered the chicken sandwich and a side of mac 'n cheese. Chicken sandwich came with bacon jam on it which was a nice touch, and the chicken itself was breaded and fried into a perfect crisp. I personally wasn't a fan of the mac 'n cheese - I thought the cheese sauce was too grainy, and it just seemed so orange it looked fake. On the other hand, my fiance loved the mac 'n cheese, so what do I know?  Beer: C  Unfortunately, this is where things go a bit down hill.We ordered a taster of 8 different beers so we could get a good feel for all they had to offer (or at least almost all of it). They were good size tasters, so it was actually a perfect amount to split between two people. I think for the size of them, the price point was good.  It wasn't too expensive. The CardinALE Red was my favorite. It was a well-balanced beer that was super drinkable. My least favorites were the bourbon-barrel aged pumpkin beer, and also the imperial stout. The pumpkin beer had WAY too much bourbon flavor. Part of me can't believe I just typed that (as I'm a huge whiskey fan), but it just didn't fit in this beer. It was very overpowering. Overall, the beers here just didn't stand out to me much  Creativity: C  Between the beer and the food, I felt that the creativity was a bit lacking compared to other breweries. I loved the service and the overall vibe of the place, but again - feel like they could improve with execution on some beers and some creativity on the menu.

We didn't try the food, it looked good though. The beer was fan-tas-tic! My favorite was the Spiral Man Oatmeal Stout my husband likes the CardinAle Red. We highly recommend the North Mountain Brewery!
Soooooooo much better!  I've now been here several times since my last review and the food/service has gotten much better!

So I posted a review on here yesterday and was contacted by their Manager/Owner(?) and was told that what I had written was incorrect. I wrote about sour beers and they don't make any sour beers. Yep, totally correct, I mistook this place with another brewery here in Phoenix and I just copied and pasted to that other one. To my knowledge, first time I've ever made this mistake, so....  3 1/2. I came here because I was in the neighborhood and actually tried another craft beer bar but it didn't serve draft beer so I left that place and found this place.  I sat at the bar and ordered a flight of beers, though I only did 6 and not the 8 they offer! Upon recommendation I also ordered the lumpia, which I've never seen on a menu. Well, except at a Filipino place. All the beers are solid and I liked them. I didn't think any beer I had was amazing but I'd definitely come back and drink some more beer. My lumpia was actually way overcooked. The meat inside was literally black inside. I never return food so I didn't say anything.  Well, I struck up a conversation with the gentleman sitting next to me, and he asked me how the lumpia was. So I told him and the bartender overheard me. At this point, I was done with the night and ready to go home so she took away the lumpia. Mind you, I still at about half the plate, maybe a little more, mostly the burnt ones. So when I got the bill she completely removed the lumpia off the bill and only charged me for the beers. That was pretty cool, I honestly wasn't expecting that, though I had every right to say something, but I never do, so it was somewhat serendipity.  So overall I had a pretty good time and I liked the crowd this place attracted. Seemed more the blue-collar type people rather than some of these other craft beer places. Would definitely come back to try more beer and eat other food and adjust my rating appropriately.
Ok, the beers are outstanding, but the poutine is amazing!  Short ribs, braised to perfection.  With gravy.  Over fries and cheese curds (be still, my Wisconsin-girl heart).  Yum!!

Terrific IPA! Owners Rob and his wife came over to our table. Friendly and welcoming atmosphere reminiscent of  our Portland and other western brewery experiences. Will definitely be back for the beer, atmosphere and pretzel bread!
Good beer, good food, friendly staff, and just overall a great local place to get a good locally brewed beer.  I'll definitely be back!
Tuesday was open-mic night; actually good music and made atmosphere just right. Beers are really good. Liked the CREEM and Serendipitous the best.

This place is so good! You can do 6 or 8 4 3/4 oz tasters which is a lot but you can try a variety of their beers. My favorite was the C.R.E.E.M. If you come here, you must try the short rib poutine! All the food we ordered was great (especially for a brewery). Our waiter was friendly and helpful. Great place even for kids.

Love this place! They have good beer especially the Nerotic belgian and the bearded dragon IPA. $5 taco special is the bomb!. Fish and chips are done just right! Jessica is an awesome bartender and can pour a beer like no other! Even though its in Sunnyslope its awesome and has a cool little patio!
Fantastic food and beer. The ambience here is great, as is the service. Our waitress told us this place has been around for five years. I wish we'd come here sooner. Highly recommended.
I went during the Blue Brews & Arts Fest. It was such a fun festival. Great crowd, beer, and food.
Brussels sprouts are amazing, crab dip, pretzel bread. Awesome, good beer, got the burger of the week, the reuben, very good but not enough pastrami to taste it. Will definitely be back!

Beers were decent but not memorable. Had the spoiled dove dirty blonde ale and the hefamerica- they were light and crisp which you want on a hot summer day. However, it had the general light beer flavor you can find anywhere, nothing special.  I ordered the north mountain burger medium, it was over cooked and had more bread then burger. The flavor was satisfying and fixed my burger craving. My bf got the crab dip that is advertised to have 'lumps' of crab meat- there was no crab meat and it took forever for him to get his requested sourdough bread for it. The server can back to deliver other items four different times and had to be reminded twice about the sourdough bread. Overall our server seemed to care more about his other tables and barely came over; was hoping to try another beer but gave up because he took so long.  So overall the brewery was okay, service lacking, might go back eventually.
The brews and the chicken sandwich... and all of the appetizers... are sooo good. Definitely worth the trip from the far west valley! We've been here 2 times now and it has been flawless both times.

Came Saturday night. Live music a treat. The Brussels sprouts salad was divine. Fish and chips were average. Fries were thin cut the way I like them. Glasses on the beer flights are 4 or 5 ounces, so be careful if you are driving. Mike the waiter was very entertaining.
Excellent pork sliders which left our mouths watering and pro tip, get their beer samplers of all 12 beers! Nice place and sad that I found it while leaving this place
Visited this restaurant while moving last weekend and we all enjoyed our food and beers. My favorite part was their ability to "nitro-style" any of their beers. Yum! We'll be back to try more..
Service was non existent.  Took at least 15 minutes to get my first beer and I was one of 4 people in the whole place :(

Good beer, good place, food is decent could use some work  Most of the time the beer is great! Last time we order one not so great. It was a newly tapped keg of Hefe and it came out looking like mud. Mouth feel was course and grainy. Flavor was off too from all the trub still free floating around. They were friendly and understood and took it off our bill. If this were my brew pub that beer would have never left the bar and ended up in the drain.  I like that they serve their beer in the correct glass style for each beer style. You don't get that much any more because places are lazy and only serve in pints or mugs. YES IT REALLY MAKES A DIFFERENCE. But if Coors Light is your favorite beer you probably won't understand.  I would return without hesitation.

Visited North Mountain Brewing Company the other night on a whim. (A friend's whim, actually.) It wasn't until I arrived that I realized I had been there once before a couple of years ago to watch a different friend of mine perform live with her band.  I remembered this as I walked up to the entrance and, sure enough, was greeting by the sound of live music playing again as I entered. Being a musician myself, and long-time lover of live music, this was an instant hit for me. I found a seat and got comfortable.  The first time I ever visited North Mountain Brewing Company, I didn't order any food, just a beer. It was so long ago that I can't remember having any impressions of the beer one way or another. I just remember liking the feel of the place.  This time, I was here for dinner. AND a beer. So, as I sat at a small table for two in the very center of the room, surrounded by the sounds of acoustic ambiance, I began to peruse the beer and food menus as if for the very first time.  I was impressed to find so many original beers on the menu. Good ones, too - including the beer that I ordered which was an Imperial Red IPA. YUMM!!! My friend ordered a red ale, which was equally delicious in its own way.  We were helped by a pretty young server named Alisa. She was super helpful and more than willing to answer all our questions. I made a point of getting her name off the receipt so that I could mention her in this review. She was great.  My friend ordered the Fish & Chips, and I ordered the Poutine at Alisa's recommendation. Both entrees were tasty, although not as standout as the beer, in my opinion. I'd rate both entrees a 4 out of 5, but my friend really enjoyed her Fish & Chips.  Overall, the experience was a win. I plan to go back and try more off the food menu. I'm especially excited to go back and try more off the BEER menu. (I drove from North Scottsdale and that alone is worth the trip.)  If you haven't been to North Mountain Brewing Company, I'd recommend it based on my experience there. If you're really lucky, you'll get Alisa as your server. Make it even more interesting and find a time when they're playing live music (they do this often).  Thank you, North Mountain Brewing, for creating some truly enticing beers. (Probably some of my favorite in the Valley currently.) And thank you, Alisa, for such outstanding service. I'll look forward to seeing you all again soon.  :)

The food was okay, nothing to get too excited about. If you are looking for a nice place to enjoy a couple beers and have a bite to eat, you probably won't be disappointed. There is an extensive craft beer menu.  Service was pretty slow. We had to flag down a waitress and ask for our check after 10 minutes of sitting with empty plates and cups.
Never, ever, ever eat the chicken fried steak. I'm not sure if it, or the gravy, were more tasteless. Service was also very lackluster.

Went there on a Wednesday night, about happy hour time, but did have dinner.  Place was fairly busy for a Wednesday during June.  They had live music which made it kind of fun.  I am a fan of local craft beer, and this place ranks right up there with the best.  As with any small brewer, the selection can depend on what they have recently made.  Had the amber and the stout, and both were excellent.  The food is typically pub food, and is very good (the kids liked the pretzels so much, we had to order more), but had some interesting twists (the poutine, for example, which was very good).  And the service was very good.  Our waiter was busy with other tables, but was attentive to our needs.    Overall, glad this place is around, and suggest to anyone that like local brew pubs to venture over there.

Glad I finally checked this place out!  The BEST fish n chips in the valley. Zipps used to be my #1. I still think Zipps fries are better but North Mountain has the best fish!  Lots of choices on beer rotating on nine taps. The pretzel bread is so delicious with the honey butter!  The place is super clean, the staff was nice and they have a lovely outdoor patio area. Free life music nightly. Open mike night on Tuesdays.

The boys are in town. We are having a good time. Good beer and the lumpia was good and fast. 2nd brewery tonight. Good place to have a large group and with good appetizers and beer. Not the slow service as I had seen in prior posts.

One of my favorite spots in Central Phoenix! They have an ever-changing beer menu and with each change, the beer is getting better and more interesting! I came in for a good local beer and was surprised by the food choices and the quality of the food. This brewery has hit the mark for overall places to visit; great beer, food, and atmosphere! I will be back, and have been back several times.
Beers are pretty good. Food not too good. Why a 2? They charge tax at the bar for a beer. Nobody heard of tavern act or bar1, bar2. Bad form and I am not sure if it is legitimate.

"LOFTY LOFT" Industrial ceilings, Long tables, good for sharing n' meeting nice people. First experience was very warming, Michael our server is well informed, I gave him a few of MY recommendations as he is a newbe to our fair State !! Needless to say, We were impressed with him and the delightful menu selection, Didn't do the beer tasting but it looked like fun.  I'll be back :D:D  Sharlene PHX AZ       P.S. Maureen, I did return the Menu.

Stopped in here for happy hour a few days ago.   Nice space, very big and open. Played good music while we were there, and quite a few large TVs with some hot beach volleyball chicks on. Nice. Bar is a bit small (and full), so we ended up with a table. Our waitress was solid. Good service, never had empty drinks.  Food was OK. Had a burger special, girlfriend had some kind of "Asian " sliders. My burger was cooked as ordered, but had zero flavor. Her sliders were far better, but not out of this world. Menu seems to offer a lot, so we'll delve deeper next time.   AZ beers are typically terrible, but the 6 house brews we tried were decent. They seem to produce a lot of varieties, so I'm sure I can find 1-2 that are worth ordering again.   Happy hour pricing is very reasonable.This was a nice find. In striking distance by bike, and an overall good experience. We will be back.

Well I need admit this is not my scene. Sharing communal tables with hipsters that drum on them while you trying to have dinner and listening to strange indie bands is not my idea of a good time.  Food was decent, I was not a far of the beers, found one that I could drink. Service was good, but this place is not for me.  The place is packed so if this is your scene come early.

I really enjoyed the purplesaurus hefe.  The raspberry fruitiness is wonderful, especially on a hot summer evening.  My husband ordered the southwest burger medium. .. it came out extra well done. This didn't please his palette.  However he drank several beers and enjoyed his time in this rustic/industrial restaurant.  They had a live band playing classic rock. Service was great! I'll be back. Enjoyed myself.

I like eating at places that have a relaxed atmosphere, unprotencious service and most importantly, good food. For this place, the food was good, but the atmosphere was great. I liked the blue grass band playing in the background, the quick attentive service and the wide open space that was comfortable. The food was good too... I had the southwestern burger and my husband had their normal burger. We also had brussels sprouts and macaroni and cheese along with the Hefe and Ale.  This place is super close to my house and we'll definitely be back!
Great staff. Very down to earth.  Awesome beer, that changes all the time. Recommend the brussel sprouts, ahi tuna and the spent grain cookie is crazy good.

North Mountain has definitely hit its stride--vibe is good, live music some nights and the food just keeps getting better.  Had the poutine  recently--it was great and the fries were crispy.  Beer continues to be great for people with all tastes and level of beer knowledge.
First visit: Good food. Good beer. Kind of a sketchy neighborhood. Decent service. We'll be back.
One  of my tops place to eat, my husbands and sons best place for draft beers! My fav appetizer, lumpias.

Met some friends and family here for lunch on a Sunday.  Wasn't too busy and the atmosphere was comfortable.  The bar was lined with fans watching football games on the televisions, a few small groups were scattered around the room talking and outside a couple guys were smoking pipes, which smelled great.  Very relaxed.  Our server checked in regularly and gave generous samples of the beers we were interested in trying.  The brewery's own beers were very good.  Food was great.  The pretzel rolls with beer cheese and house mustard were average, but the daily special soup, a green chile and potato mixup, tasted exceptional, despite being very bland visually.  The sausage platter was delicious and came with generous portions of sausages cooked to perfection.  My wife had the waffle and enjoyed it.  Their beef sandwich was very much Philli-style and, although not nearly as good as a real-deal cheesesteak, it was tasty and filling.  The price of food and appetizers are a bit on the high side, which is my only major complaint, if I had to have one.  Beers had a wide range of prices, but were generally decent and the limited, but well diversified selection was nice.  I plan to visit North Mountain Brewing Co. again very soon.  Recommended!

Awesome little place with good microbrews and really good food.  I had the steak sandwich the first time and it was like a Philly cheesesteak sandwich.  They use blue cheese on the sandwich which tasted really good.  The 2nd time I had the Poutine which is a very unique dish.  I guess it is a Canadian dish but I never had it before.  It was really good and it only cost $12.  It is french fries topped with short rib, cheese curds, and gravy.  It is a really hearty dish and you get a lot for the money.  I really think they could charge a lot more for this dish.  The short ribs melt in your mouth!  They had some live acoustic music on Friday which was nice and they played some good classic rock songs.  This won't be the last time I go here, I really like this place.  09/24/15 the Poutine portion was smaller then the last time I had it, about half the amount of short rib.

This place is a great addition to Sunny Slope. Stopped in for the first time last week with coworkers from out of town. The Beer and food was great. Had a small mistake with splitting the charges over different credit cards. The staff and owner bent over backwards to correct the mistakes. North Mountain Brewing Co is now number 2 for me in the Sunny Slope area. (Sorry but Corbins is still my favorite).
Beers r just okay for a micro brewery and prices r on high side.  Service was good and friendly staff.  Great potential but just not there yet.

Here's what we had at about 3:30 in the afternoon.  No one but maybe 2 people in the whole place. Which is understandable on a weekday.  Tried the lumpia egg rolls which would probably have been great if the oil wasn't dirty oil and they were not over done on the outside. My buddy had the fish fry which is Alaskan cod but there was an immense amount of breading on it and for 3 pieces and shoe string fries not worth the cost and I had the poutine which was delicious however it wasn't a lot of beef ( they put beef and cheese curd over French fries with a gravy ) as for beers or anything I can't include those cuz neither my friend nor I drink . We just thought that the menu looked appealing. The beers looked ( according to description) pretty tasty but the food ( or at least the fryer oil should have been cleaned) probably won't be back

This should be your go-to if you're looking for a local beer experience.  I'm not a beer person but their hefe is out of this world.  I actually drank the entire thing which is RARE for me.  (I usually drink about half.  Doesn't matter the size - I just want half.)    The food was delicious.  The burger special abomination was a burger topped with an onion ring, mac n' cheese, short ribs and unicorn sprinkles - happy tummies at the table.  My poutine was delicious - my only complaint about it (and this super picky) is that the curds were melted.  But, that is a small price to pay for rich gravy and potato-y goodness.    Desserts are another category entirely.  The grain cookie is just stupid.  The husband makes beer and has made some wonderful dense dark breads out of spent grain.  I didn't think a cookie was possible but it is - it's reminiscent of an oatmeal cookie and topped with ice cream and served WARM... you're welcome.  We also got the malt which was tasty but I'd choose the cookie again in a heartbeat.    This joint isn't even remotely in our neighborhood but we'll be comin' back.

Went here on a Saturday evening at approx. 8:30 pm for a brew and some food.  It was not busy - in fact there was an abundance of seats available on the inside.  We sat outside, ordered a beer and our food.  The beer was good and delivered promptly.  We order a burger and pizza and proceeded to wait for over 45 minutes for our food. The server did come back several times to tell us there were several large orders in front of us.  There were barely 30 people total on the inside and there were 3 cooks working the kitchen.  We were just getting ready to ask for our check for the beers and leave when she brought the food out.  The only thing that saved the evening was the food was good and the server was very friendly and apologetic about the long wait.  Not sure I would go back here for food, but the beer was (Hefe) was good.

LUMPIA!  Okay, why lumpia hasn't caught on mystifies me.  These tasty Filipino pork and veggie egg rolls are amazing.  NMBC offers a generous serving as an appetizer with two sauces.  The peanut sauce is all you need, though.  Also tried the pretzel bread.  Hot and tasty with the right amount of chewiness.  A honey cinnamon butter, cheese sauce and spiced mustard came for dipping the pretzels.  Had the CardinAle Red, which was very smooth and flavorful.  Entrees were good, too.  But, seriously, go for the lumpia!
News flash St. Patrick's day is a "drinking" holiday. Being told it will be a hour for food but then ignored for that hour is unacceptable! Left after 45mins of receiving our flight with no service.
Excellent food and great beer. Great atmosphere for the neighborhood and a good deal. Napkins need upgrading.

They have 12 types of local beer there. In addition there is a great system to enjoy many beer at the same time by flights, they have 6 beer flight and 8 beer flight. I really enjoyed drinking many types of beer there.  Also their foods were appropriate saltiness so really good. But I would like to recommend this restaurant to add flight glasses because of their limitations to serve flights to many customers. At least my friends and I were waiting for next serve repeatedly.

We've been here twice and everything we've had is so delicious. My husband had ordered the sausage platter twice, our kids have had the burger, cheese pizza and Mac and cheese, I've had the fish and chips and the Shepherd's pie and omg, it's my favorite so far. Oh and the Crab dip and Poutine are too... Ok, I can't pick a favorite because they're all so good. Service is awesome with super, super friendly staff. They've totally made a regular customer out of us. Can't review their beers because none of us are beer drinkers but everyone else in the restaurant seems to be enjoying theirs, so they must be really good. If you don't like beer, definitely go for the food! :-)
Wow..unexpected goodness. Lumpias!!  Take a hike then stop in for cold beer and  great food.

This brewery has a great vibe inside along with a large food menu. I was impressed with the number of beers they have on tap. You can get a flight of 6 or 8 that are just under 5oz pours for $12-15 ($2 off if you're there during happy hour) which I find to be a great value. I wasn't overly impressed with any of their beers in particular, but loved the atmosphere and will certainly be returning!

Group of 6 (plus baby which was just fine) just enjoyed a birthday celebration at North Mountain. With numerous people in our group very critical towards beer there was a level of quality we all expected, and to say the least it was matched. Impressive diversity of beers combined with unique cask options (we tried one from a tequila barrel). Combine this with great food ( must try the poutine) we will be back without a doubt! Check it out...

We went to the soft opening as well as last nights grand opening and the servers, chef and staff were great given the overwheing customers that came. Food was delicious and the beers were great. I don't know why people would complain about the wait which was not bad 30 min wait is average even at ie Red Lobster,Macaroni Grill for a Friday or Saturday night heck given that this is North Mountain Brewery opening weekend the wait was a breeze. I will come back for sure.

This is a place that is still growing.  I learned a little from the marketing director for NMB; their roots are in home brew.  Like many microbrew start-ups, they are learning how to be a restaurant along with making craft beer.  I believe they will get better at this so I cut them a break when it come to the food/service side.  That being said my server was great - very responsive with quick service.  The beer was off-the-hook fantastic.  This is a family operation so it will be exciting to watch it grow.  I think they have their heart in the right place so if you have any problems, please give them constructive pointers; but if you do, make sure you give a holistic view with not only the misses but the hits.  Candy, I will be back.
Not having poutine before, I'm addicted now!   I'm not sure how it could be better.  And the brussel sprouts were a great pairing.  Definitely a place to return to!

This place is awesome! The food was delicious and the beers were just as amazing. We tried the Justin, Mountain Burger, Oysters, Lumpia (FAVORITE), and the Shepards pie; none of which disappointed and was like a party for my taste buds. Will be for sure frequenting this place when I next visit Phoenix from LA.

I've been three times and not once have I been impressed by the beer. It wasn't very cold, it went warm within minutes, and didn't sit well with me. The stout is the only one I'd ever order again.   Each time I've gone, I've had a flight of every beer that I hadn't already tried. The flight of 6 is $14! I didn't even end up drinking more than 1 full taster. Keep in mind these are a little bit larger than normal tasters. I should have had the mead flight instead.   Never mind the high price of the flight, the food is outrageously expensive for a brewery. I couldn't get even a side to snack on for less than $7. They have a great quality menu, I don't doubt that, but it's not budget friendly by any means and the beer price certainly doesn't make up for it. I haven't walked out under $20 for a quick bite/beer stop once.   The bartenders aren't the friendliest. Last time I asked for a beer menu and she pointed to the wall and walked away. Then her friends, or regulars rather, walked in to sit at the bar and they asked for one and she handed it right to them. They were also asked for beers before I was as well.   The waitresses gossip at the end of the bar  while waiting for their drinks very loudly about how annoying their customers were being. It went something like, "Table x over there is so annoying, she wanted x with a side of x and I thought, you're so stupid!" It was just catty and unnecessary. I wouldn't mention this because I vent about my customers too once in a while, but it's happened all three times I've been here with different girls on different days. Not cool.

Seriously, drove all the way from Los Angeles and this was our very first meal in good ole Arizona!!! Came to AZ for the Phoenix Open and this place is absolutely delicious!! The staff is super friendly and I LOVE their poutine!!!!  P.S. Added #Bacon for that extra fee!!!! #NoProblems #Yum

Ok people... Take a breath and reign in your inner bitch. This is the FIRST couple days of what will be a jewel of the neighborhood. Just like any new neighbor having guests over for the first time, your job as a guest is to welcome them first... Hold back on your criticism as if they owe you something because they we're blessed by your company. First impressions? Yes, the 4$ valet is not in line with the neighborhood norms. Adjust. Yea, live music! Live music by the front door?! Maybe not... Also, put up some artwork or other stuff to breakup the bare wall space. Ok... That's it. Nothing else to crab about cuz I was here two days in a row and I'm ready to go back tonight. The food was GREAT. Good portions, better than I make at home, and less than it would cost to make/burn myself. Great beers too! The one I disliked most is still delicious! How often can you say that?! Plus, I enjoy that it's not "service" so much as a bunch of people who like to cook and serve food and beer, hanging out with their neighbors. Like contributing to a pot luck with cash instead of potato salad. Don't get lost in the expectations of what you are buying with your dollar. Come, sit, eat, drink, listen, meet, share, taste, smell, speak, thank and ENJOY your neighbors and your neighborhood! ;) You can thank me later... Cheers!

The first time I came here was last year just a few months after they opened.  We were a big group for lunch and we had a pretty good time.  I don't remember what I had then, but I liked their beer.  Last Friday I went again for a UYE.  Our server was fabulous, really nice,  I like light beers, but with a little taste, not bitter.  He let me sample a couple he suggested and our host let me taste the Hefe Endings, which is the one I was eyeing.  I ended up with the Hefe.  My husband and I shared the southwest burger, we usually do that because most burgers lately are so gigantic and I don't need that many calories, don't get me wrong, I can finish it, I am just trying to be a little more conscious now that my metabolism is not as it used to be.  Well this burger is not that big.  It is pretty tasty and spicy (in a good way if you like spicy), but is not gigantic, its average size and I needed something extra, so my husband asked for the asian pulled pork sliders.  Not my favorite.  I am glad they are small and I had one, my husband could take the rest.  The ambiance is really nice and since we had a great group, I had a very good time.

North Mountain Brewing was the second stop on the Brews Cruise UYE. Just from setting up a reservation for us, I could tell we were in for an awesome time!  I called in to reserve a table for our expected group of 18. I was worried I'd have to reschedule or have us at different tables when the hostess told me there was already a bigger group reservation for that same time. But she told me she'd have the manager Candy call me back to see what we could do.   Candy was quick to get back to me and not only was she more than accommodating to having both groups there, she even managed to set us up in a single table so we didn't have to be separated! She went way above and beyond to make this happen and I owe her a huge thank you!  I also want to thank our server Chris. He had the daunting task of taking care of all of us and did an amazing job.   The brewery itself was amazing. Great decor that included art pieces from local artists in a wide open dining area.
