Nice bartender who was really helpful, and even brought our food to the table near the stage.   Would love to come back here, for sure.  This place is a winner! ...And I'm giving this place 5 stars just because I loved the cleanliness and cuteness of this brightly lit place with the best homemade brewery beer I've had so far in Phoenix.

Stopped in for a quick lunch on a Saturday. Not too busy. Service was good. They had a very basic veggie pizza as the only veg option. Not great, but the beer flights are good. Nice little patio. Seems like a good neighborhood spot.

I came from Sacramento on a business trip so was unfamiliar with the local brewery scene. I saw this place had good reviews so thought it was worth a try. We had the flight with some appetizers. The pretzel bread was good, but the honey butter that came with it was amazing! The lumpia was very good as well. For the beers, I liked the IPA and the baby Belgian. The Hefeweizen, C.r.e.e.m., and stout were good as well and worth trying. Overall, this place is still young, and as such, has some things that could use work, but there is definitely some great things they are doing and are have a bright future ahead of them.

I went here when it first opened and the beer and menu was lacking, so I haven't been back. Well, I went back with a friend because he hasn't been there yet and I do have to say that the menu has been revamped quite a bit and actually had quite a few things that I wanted. Also, they have a couple of IPAs on the menu, which was a huge improvement from last time.  I will be going back soon to try the pizza.

Had the pastrami sandwich and honey had the grilled cheese. Their beers are very good. Pastrami was 4 stars, a little dry for me. Honey said the grilled cheese needed more bacon, I liked it. The french fries are shoestring cut, really crispy, 5 stars there.
Good beer, good service, music is too frickin loud. Would have stayed longer but damn..... We can't talk

This brewery rocks!!!  Love the atmosphere of this place as if is very casual and you just want to hang out. It is great for bigger parties or to chill at the bar by your self.   The beer selection is pretty big and always seems to be rotating.   But the food is where they really shine! The selection is amazing, and normally when a place has a bigger selection the food isn't as good but everything I have had so far is so delicious. The sliders are perfect start to split with a small group! Then the shareable sides are so good!   GET THE BRUSSELS SPROUTS! Also steak sandwich is on point!   Get her now!!!

Great enivronment. Hidden location - which is what made it appealing, like a neighborhood secret. Everyone was friendly. Good energy.  My only turnoff - is im not a fan of the new cafeteria seating trend
Had our first visit last night to see Jane in the Jungle perform.   Great live music, cool vibe, delicious food, and outstanding beers.

Now that's a good beer! (All of them)   North Mountain, you have potential for the 5 star but I haven't had your food. That's my bad but you got a great place!   Been here a handful of times now and it's definitely out of the way but it's worth the drive. I would recommend (and do) to anyone.   Good vibe. Good beer. Nice people.   Go for it!   #brewtour2016

We ate at North Mountain Brewery for the first time tonight. Randy says his hamburger was delicious and so was my fish and chips.  There were other items on the menu that also looked good I.e. Pizza. The prices seemed a little high, but probably comparable to other restaurants in the area. Randy liked their Creme Ale and I also thought it tasted delicious. We'll probably go back, but maybe during Happy Hour.

This place was great.  We had a large party and they accommodated us on short notice.  The service was awesome.  The food and beer were very good, we were a big party and everyone enjoyed what they ordered.
Great food.  We went there for fish on lent. My husband loved the fish and chips. Beer was great. I had the kale salad which was wonderful. Good service.

We enjoyed our first visit. Our group was given a private room. Lunch of fish and chips was tasty with heavy breading. Coleslaw a little heavy on the ginger. Big dining room looked like a fun place to enjoy the R&R music on Wed evenings! Will go back for the music and try another meal. Beer was fine!

Just had the burger of the week, which is a Reuben burger this week. Oh was it good! And next week they'll change it up again. Ordered the Czech your mind, which is an imperial pilsner, and shared it with my husband. Then ordered the Tiempo de la Saison, a Saison aged in tequila barrels, which I kept for myself. I love the environment here, the people, the food. Not to sound corny, but it's like Cheers when you're "family," everyone knows your name.. I'll always come back. I'm slightly biased because I know everyone there, and my husband has been head chef for a year. But I've also brought friends who've never been and now they're also hooked. *Order the lumpia for sure, and cheese dip
Great place...tasty DIPA and awesome food!  Obvious Filipino touch including inay mamma and tasty lumpia and killer brussel sprout warm salad.  Can't go wrong!

Always a pleasure to eat, drink and relax here. Staff are always nice. The brews are spectacular. Mayor Greg Stanton has even enjoyed this establishment. Try the Grooving With The Pict brew. Had the fish n chips. Crispy battered. Not usually a fan of tarter sauce but theirs has a great non overpowering taste with a hint of wasabi. Had the pretzel bread with added cheese. My son loves the sweet dip. For dessert. The freshly baked cookie with icecream is a must.

I sadly give North Mountain a less than enthusiastic review because I had such high expectations.  Unfortunately, while the beer was fairly good, the service needed some serious attention.    We went the day after the grand opening and waited ten minutes for them to figure out where they were going to seat us when they had more than half of their tables available.  Then, it took another fifteen minutes for us to get a server who would take our drink and appetizer order.  By the time we finally got our beers and pretzels, we were so discouraged that we opted to go have dinner elsewhere.    Also, this place isn't nearly as kid friendly as most of the other breweries in town--it's mostly an eclectic adult menu--or if they have a kids menu, nobody told us about it. I would definitely give them another shot, but they need to figure out how to serve their patrons in a more organized fashion.

Food was pretty good there. Have to park on back of building cause off of a main road so go to next street to get into it, it's easier. Our first server was pretty good but only had him to order our good. Girl we got next was nice but I had to go find someone to get our check cause after she cleared table never came back n them had to find someone else to give check to in order to get it paid. By the way, they weren't busy.

It needs to be said that North Mountain Brewing has the BEST poutine in the Valley, period!   Thick, delicious french fries with a healthy dousing of brown gravy. Some of the most tender short rib I've ever had.   And let's not forget those ooey, gooey cheese curds.  Thankfully with all of this, it wasn't overly salty.  We dropped in here for one of Dude's Brews Cruise UYEs and the crew at North Mountain was nothing short of accommodating with our group of 15.   Our server Chris was on top of making beer recommendations and getting tasters for our various beer drinkers in the group.   We were pretty sure that North Mountain wouldn't be willing to make a reservation for 18 on a Friday, but Candy the manager was a sweetheart (we got to meet her!) and made it happen, no questions asked.    I'm not the Captain of these beer-swilling events and had to drive, so sadly didn't imbibe. I did get a sip of the Barrel Aged CardinAle red which tasted like a hoppier red I could tolerate.   North Mountain Brewing is another excellent option in our growing Phoenix brewery scene - Looking forward to coming back and trying a full flight.

Well it took me over a year to finally try out North Mountain. I don't know what took me so long but I'm glad I finally got a time to visit. We came on a Saturday night and I was impressed with the set up. We sat at the bar which has a view of the kitchen and there was a small band playing.  While sitting at the bar we were met with a friendly bartender that knew all of the beers and seemed to really enjoy his work. Wish I would have caught his name.   Ordered the IPA which was really good. Tried my friend's brown and it was really good as well. We also tried the loaded Mac and cheese and it was awesome!  I've heard that the food here is really good.   Overall I will come back to NMBCo. Seems like a good place to eat dinner with a great beer or just a place to enjoy a beer or two with friends.   On a side note parking is in the pack and don't drive too fast or you will miss the entrance!

Worst food ever!!!  Ordered off the brunch menu, breakfast corn dogs sounded good. Pancake batter dipped sausage, scrambled eggs and hash browns. Where to start...eggs had a grey hue to them, sausage thing was burnt and dripping in grease, hash browns were ice cold and tasteless. Husband had a burger which was overdone and the bread was hard. We just wanted food and not beer. Other yelp reviews said the food was really good and restaurant was close to home so we thought we would give local a try. Sad to say we still have to travel a bit out of our area to get a decent bite to eat.

Excellent beer period! Not mass produced. We had amazing beer and the best crap dip. Next time we will have dinner. Great friendly crowd. The bar tender was excellent, very attentive and even arranged a personal tour on the spot of the back room brewery! We will be back.

I had higher expectations for this place. I ordered my hamburger medium-rare and it came out medium-well. If it was cooked properly it probably would have been good. The fries were good. Service was spotty at best.

We were looking for a casual spot for dinner and decided to give North Mountain a try.  Food was good (shoestring fries!), good beer, decent prices ($4 glass of house wine), attentive service. All around a good experience.

Awesome beer selection and awesome spot to hang out. Service wasn't the greatest. Our server definitely didn't want to be there and we all said we wouldn't get the same meal again but the beer selection made up for it. Get a flight. Too many good ones to just pick one.

This brewery is excellent! Only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is one of the waiters is terrible. Worst service I've ever seen...however every other waiter does an excellent job. Beer and food is great!

One of my favorite breweries to enjoy an amazing meal. Consistently good service and so many tasty food and beer options. Great atmosphere with a private room if you are looking to have a group event. We made North Mountain part of our brewery tour beer tour bachelor/bachelorette party and they took such good care of us. If you haven't already checked this place out I would highly recommend it.
I have to tell you I don't often travel to Sunny Slope but this place is very cool and unexpected.   The food was great and the beer very good as well.   Fun time

Well, the hubby and I were up in North Phoenix a couple weekends ago and I just had to stop in and check out North Mountain Brewing Co. I had bookmarked them after stopping by their booth at the Strong Beer Festival in February but they are pretty far from where we live so I hadn't gotten around to paying them a visit even though I have seen some pretty good reviews from fellow Yelpers. Unfortunately we had just had a huge meal so we did not sample any of the food but I did try all four beers that they had on tap that day. Their production facility is pretty small so they don't make a whole lot but the nice thing is they do also keep some other local brews on tap so you are sure to find something you would like to drink.  I tried the four that they make themselves. First off was their Funk 49 wheat ale, similar to a Hefeweizen but with a bit more flavor. It was a nice light beer, perfect for summer, and had a pleasant mild taste with a crisp citrus aftertaste. Hubby ordered one of those put an orange in it, as he is wont to do. Next we tried the CREEM Ale. This one was a bit lighter than I was expecting but surprisingly enough I really liked it and ended up ordering a pint. I can't remember how they categorized it but to me it was like a very mild red ale but with some really strong caramel undertones. We also tried their pale ale which as expected was a bit too hoppy for me and their Nonpartisan lager which also as expected was too tasteless (nothing against NMB, I just don't care for pale ales or lagers). I look forward to trying their stout some day since that one sounds great!  We had a great time chatting with the friendly bartender. Everyone working there seemed really nice and they greeted most folks by name as they entered (it was the middle of the day so they were not busy). Even though the interior looks brand spanking new and everything was pretty shiny and modern, it still had a homey feel to it since the space was small and very open. Also, the smells coming from the kitchen were mouth watering and their menu looks fantastic. I love the fact that they have some traditional pub food but then throw in some unexpected twists. They even had some Vietnamese items on there. Apparently they just lost their chef so they may be reworking the menu soon, though. And it sounds like their beers change all the time. Next time we are in this neck of the woods we will definitely be back.
Great Stout, Great pizza, Great people, great place! A must for everyone! Parking is in the rear, so don't be fooled by the lack of road-front space; just look for the open patio!

TBH I didn't try any of the food here and went straight for the beer flight. All good here with the exception of their Ipacious  I.P.A. $6  (ABV=7.7% / IBU's=68) which was outstanding. Can't even remember what the others in the flight tasted like because their IPA is just that good.

This was my first time here and it was much larger than I was expecting. A good number of beers on tap, all of them brewed there. Plenty of seats at the bar and a large, open room with several tables. I would recommend a flight of 6 or 8 because they have so a large selection. I started with a stout and it was excellent. It was the winner of the first annual Brewer's Ball put on by Badwater Brewing this year. Second, I have a dirty blonde - which was also excellent. While there I was able to sample a few other beers and I would have been happy with any of them. Additionally, I ordered the fish and chips - three nice short and fat pieces of fish, thin french fries and very good. Plus the staff was incredibly friendly and I enjoyed talking with them. Definitely check out this place if you are on that side of town.
This place is awesome! We were close by and decided to stop in. So glad we did. Beers were on point! Excellent beers and Bernie was very informative and recommended beers. He was a great beer tender.

Not a fan of this place, we've gone here a few times since we don't like to trek far from the house and were always disappointed. The hostess (owners wife) is rude, customer service is not on their menu only to serve you get your money and onto the next patron. It's always really busy, loud and the food is nothing really to brag about. After reading all the reviews looks like they have serious issues with customer service, even if the waiters and waitress' are good it's the first impression of the hostess that sets the precedent to decide whether or not patrons will return.

I'm currently visiting Phoenix for the Copa America Mexico Vs Uruguay game , was looking up local bars & lounges to grab a quick bite and drink . Saw the reviews and decided to give this place a shot . I ordered their 8 craft bundle deal and the Amazing ITALIAN SUB with the greatest side of fries I ever tasted . The waiters here are nice and friendly and work at a fast pace , constantly checking up to make sure everything is A Ok . Love this place Here and will be returning if I'm ever in Phoenix again :) this place deserves more than 5 stars ! Thank you Baby Jesus for the North Mountain Brewery .
Music night has a great live set.  They are definitely above bar level.  Food is good and great beers on tap. Plus patio is killer.

Wow, there's quite a few reviews here that are highly critical of a place that's barely been open for two months! Heck, when I started my new job, I didn't know what I was doing for at least 3 months... Anyway, let's give some credit to the folks who decided to open a microbrew / gastropub down in the Slope during this sh*t recession! That being said, we rolled in on a Thursday night on a friend's recommendation and they earned two new customers. I had the beer flight to sample the menu, and LOVED three of them, liked three of them, and was appreciative of the other two. The crab dip was made with actual crab - not the Krab, cream cheese and mayo that my Midwestern friends seem to think is the gold standard. It's a must-have. Any eatery that has the moral turpitude to support and serve local AZ farmers and butchers' products get a tip of the cap from me. We had the sausage plate, and although I can probably get the sausages from a variety of places, the cooking and presentation was spot on. That, and the mashed potatoes rivaled that of me dear old mum's in terms of pure deliciousness. I want to go back on a packed Friday or Saturday to see if we get the same level of service (fantastic, by the way,) and to sample the rest of the menu.  The point is, Yelpers, you screwed me by not supporting my favorite local Thai place (Sa Bai Dee) and they went under. Don't break my heart again by flaming this place before they even have a chance to sort out the kinks. Keep going, bring your friends, and support your neighbors that had the gusto to open a proper gastropub. Yes, good help is hard to find; yes, they need to find their voice when it comes to the beer menu, and YES we need to team up and help a beer loving locavore put a checkmark in the "win" column.

First restaurant we decided on upon arrival from the Phoenix airport. The beer is outstanding, twenty beers on tap! If I were able to drink more, I would. Our waitress showed us exceptional service and helped us decide what meal we should get. I'm impressed.  Atmosphere is warm and the place is super clean. Highly recommended !

I drove out of my way to try this place. I had a sampler of all of their beers and I enjoyed the IPA and red ale, but overall was not thoroughly impressed by the beers. I love stouts and didn't care much for theirs. I was surprised that their blonde ale was decent since I don't usually care for lighter ales, but it had a coffee taste to it somehow.  The food was much better. I tried the cheese and meat plate which was very good. The lumpia was ok but the peanut sauce that came with it was to die for. Then I had the brussel sprouts as well as the cauliflower. Let me tell you. I love cauliflower and theirs was pretty good. I have not had brussel sprouts since I was about 8 and didn't much care for them then, but it was the description and the fact that they were on the menu that was intriguing, plus the fact that my server highly suggested them. They were soooooo amazing!!! I'm not even a huge veggie lover but I cannot convey to you how delicious these brussel sprouts were. Get them! I will go all the way back just for those, and probably have the IPA.
One of my fave brewery's and date night with the hubby. Beer is excellent and food is amazing. Owners are wonderful and super nice. Staff is helpful and awesome.

So after hearing about this place for so long, we finally went.  Ordered a flight of 12. AND the poutine, which was amazing btw.  The beers. Not one of the 12 did I hate. Most of their beers I really liked, (not a fan of I.P.A).  Everything was really awesome. We are excited to go back! Lol  Beer: tasty Food: awesome, fresh, delicious Service: can't complain!  Price: right on point. Going back? DEF!

Go try this new place! I The atmosphere is great, and the food is even better.  Unfortunately I wasn't able to try their brews... I am a light beer drinker and they were out.  I took it as a sign it was good. I will be back to try it!   Menu items were everything from burgers and fish and chips to a vegetable kale salad.   They had live music and great service... you won' t be disapointed.

Found this place via yelp, was in the area at John C Lincoln Hospital. Staff is very friendly, atmosphere is somewhat German in that there are long tables next to each other so strangers get to mix if wanted. Walls also have TV's all across with Sports on them. Got a Flight of 6 beers, I'm not an IPA fan and don't like Hoppy beers, so I wont comment on them, there was a CREME that was very tasty. We had the sausage plate and ham and cheese (it had bacon in it). Food was good and priced right, if Im in the area I will see them again.

Cool place in Sunnyslope. Went on a quiet Saturday afternoon and enjoyed the hot wings(might fine I might add) and a couple cold beers. They love the blues here as this is what played on the speakers the whole time we visited. Serious beer, cool vibe and service was decent. Wala!

Came here for the blues brews n arts fest. It was a hot April day! There was a mixed crowed of old n young. The music was pretty good. We bought beers inside to get out of the heat for a lil. The CREEM was my favorite. They had a chocolate sour that wasn't really up any of our alleys. But I'm not a sour fan anyways. They gave us the saison in like a tiny almost Dixie cup. I understand it's a higher ABV but don't charge $7 for such a lil cup. The vendors n artists outside varied from T-shirts, jewelry, paintings, n such. We didn't have any food. Might come back after checking out other breweries in the area.

Very pleasant restaurant, food was very good and great beer selection. Beers on tap with some seasonal beers and beers aged for a year, best flavors.  The flavors of the food items are made with the highest ingredients livening amazing tastes.

North Mountain is a great little brewery. The selection of beers is wide and wonderful. The NM burger is delicious and the only thing wrong with the mussels is that there are never enough. The white wine garlic butter sauce they swim in is the perfect dip for the sour dough bread.  They have a decent size patio and often have bands playing inside. This is a great addition to the Sunny Slope area.

This place is delicious and fun. I had a Kaiserlich: Dunkle Weiss. Brewed right here and full of complex delicious flavors.   Also enjoyed their wings. Spicy and big. I should have asked for ranch not a fan of blue cheese, but the wings were great.  Service was on. Always there and great suggestions. The place is all dressed up for the month in proper Oktobest style.

This was one of the few breweries we had not yet gone to in the Phoenix metro area. The interior was decent, although I didn't need to see the entire kitchen area, which was directly behind the bar. Otherwise, the decor was cute, and I liked that there was outdoor seating for those sunny days. As far as the beer, we were not impressed. It isn't bad, but nothing stood out and had that rich or unique flavor we're used to from all of the other places across the valley. If you're an IPA fan, I suggest looking elsewhere. A flight of all 8 beers cost $14, a bit steep in my opinion. Overall, an okay place to stop if you're in the area, but not really worth going out of your way for.

Stopped by when I was in the area with my family because I remembered a friend mentioning the brewery. The staff was very friendly and the food was GREAT! I am a beer lover and I got to say one of the best local breweries in Phoenix.

Walked in to NMB for the first time and was"greeted" by the hostess that wasn't that friendly. No greeting.... just " how many". Ugh... 2 please. Dropped the menus off at the table and left.  At that point.... I thought this place was going to be a bust. But Lo and Behold... Emilee was our server.  This wonderful young lady made our night! Ordered several small beers for tasting before deciding on bigger beers!  Ordered the garlic Parmesan fries and a pizza and the Shepard's pie. The food was incredible.  Not sure what I was expecting? Maybe "bar" food? It was anything but! Delicious.  A great place with fantastic beer. Family owned and operated. Beer brewed on premise.  I'll be back for sure!!
Love this place! It has great feel inside, awesome staff, some of the best beer in AZ, and actually delicious food!! If you don't like beer, then you should still visit for the food!

Great new little brewery on the Northernmost border of the area I'd call North Central.  Great food, good beer, community drinking hall style tables and Oyster menu.  I repeat.  Oyster menu.  How many places in Phoenix can you escape to for mid day  Beer Oysters and Soccer?    Really hope more people decide to give this place a chance-

We came here after seeing it on Check Please Arizona.  The beer was outstanding.  The food was ok.  My husband had the Poutine and he loved it.  I had the fish and chips.  They were a bit dry.  The ahi tuna was good but warmer than I would have liked.  The warm pretzel appetizer was very good.  My daughter had the hamburger of the day, which was a Nacho Burger.  She said it was ok but the bun fell apart right away.  I would go again for the beer.

Looking at the slew of mostly 4-5 star reviews, I must've come on an off night...but it was Sunday, and the place wasn't that full. Whatevs.  I get seated almost immediately and was served the Buddha-something beer, I forget but it wasn't bad at all! The waitress was nice and super swift, and almost literally because she was darting back and forth from kitchen/bar pass to dining...  ...which leads me to believe they were understaffed. I sipped on my beer and it was almost gone, when my food finally came. About 15-20 min wait.  My Southwest burger was luke warm at very best...flavor was meh. It had to have been sitting at an unheated pass for a little bit. The fries....I have no clue if these were even fries...they're crunchy strings of blah!  Mainly the good beer and the fast-and-best-we-can service on this given night is what kept this from a lower rating. Unsure if I'll be back, and I'm currently local to this part of town.

North Mountain Brewing Co. is definitely one of my favorite local places to eat, hands down. It is fairly close to our house, but we would drive a great distance to continue to regularly go here...it's that good! We go here on a once a week basis. Their beer menu is wonderful, and every single beer is full of flavor and unique. The food is FRESH and beyond delicious. I always have a hard time ordering something new because each meal is so amazing I want to keep ordering the same thing, but every time I try something different I have a NEW FAVORITE! My top choices are the steak sandwich, fish and chips, the North Mountain burger, and the shepherd's pie (which is MELT IN YOUR MOUTH delicious). I love the family business feel, and the owner is always on-site making sure everything is running smoothly and all the customers are happy. I feel so lucky to have found a place my fianc√© and I can eat at and feel like we're home and feel like family. We love it so much, we're even considering serving their beer at our wedding in Sedona. Do NOT pass this place up. It is a local gem.

I am typically not at a loss for words for a review, but this place is jaw droppingly  WOW.  Atmosphere: If any of you have ever read Jim Butcher's Dresden Files? Welcome to Macanally's Pub. 13 Wood Tables in the joint, 13 chairs at the bar, 13 Air Conditioning vents. (I'm a nerd so sue me), but the best part? Steak Sandwiches! We will get to that in a minute though. It was a casual relaxed atmosphere, the staff was extremely friendly, and we even took our 5 year old and he had a blast. (Note: There were other kids in there, and it wasn't awkward). I would LOVE to have a board game night here. The tables and atmosphere are PERFECT for it.  Food: We started off with the Pretzel Bread (Its a bread stick right out of the oven that is a Pretzel) with what I can only assume to be made from scratch mustard, butter, and beer cheese. My husband and I fought over the mustard and beer cheese. Then dinner came. My husband had the Poutine (Cheese Curds, Braised Short Ribs, Fries and Gravy)...let me tell you...this was one of the best things I've ever put in my mouth.....until I had my steak sandwich. This thing was straight from the Dresden Files. Fresh Bread, excellent steak, onions, peppers, and a gravy that would make your toes curl and your eyes roll back into your head. This thing was heavenly. As a side, we got the loaded mac and cheese. DO THIS. Just trust me, you are going to look at it and say ..peas? Seriously? Shut up and do it. I don't know who the chef is there, but BRAVO! The little man had their Pepperoni Flat bread Pizza and though  Drink: My husband and I ordered a flight of beer. My favorite was the Creem (spelled correctly) and the Stout. You may be sitting here nodding, but let me explain. ....I loathe stout beer. I hate it, I wont drink it. I would drink their stout by the pitcher. One warning it is rich, sip responsibly. The hubby enjoyed their lager, and the Creem as well as others.    Hands down if you have not been to this place, you need to go NOW. It was absolutely amazing, and we will be returning customers.

Went for dinner last night (Wed), good crowd but no problem getting a table. I ordered the beer sampler and each beer was very good. Much better then some of the other new breweries I've been to recently. For an app, we split the crab dip and it was good, but could have used more crackers, otherwise, creamy and tasty and chunks of crab. I had the fish n chips for dinner and that was very good too, not too big of a portion but with the appetizer, it was perfect. My child ordered the corn dog and fries, very good, not a carnival type corn dog, it was very good. I may get that next time. My girlfriend ordered a burger, unfortunately it was overcooked, she said it was tasty but she likes them medium rare and this was medium and then some. The service was great, our waitress was friendly, knew the menu, and attentive. We'll be coming back, hopefully after they get the last of their beers they offer on the menu.

The beer was great, almost on par with four peaks, the service was great also. It looses one star on the food. The "eggplant flatbread" was a cheese pizza with some giant slices of egg plant on it, and the oysters seemed small.  The other dishes we ordered (fish and chips, shepards pie, and bai min) where all pretty good. Id definatley go back.
Delicious food and great service for a private party of 25.  Beautiful presentation of all the food.
Good food. Good beers. Good service. I enjoy this local brewery and their unique beer offerings. Highly recommended! Favorite beer here: pict Scottish red ale.

Got talked into going twice to give it a second chance by some beer lovers.  Stayed away from the seafood this time and enjoyed a nice cheeseburger, not super huge but very tasty. Service was better as the place was not busy as before. The beers will still need to improve for the long haul to compete with other brew pubs but the food was a big improvement over this past weekend. Stay away from the seafood and you should be safe.
By far the best variety of local beer in north central Phoenix, and a step above most other breweries in the west valley.

I went back to @NMTBrew tonight, because it's really that amazing.  Amy was our server. She quickly informed us that the guest brew, the Pumpkin Porter, was out, and that they had just that hour tapped the Mountain Stout.  I sampled it, as well as their Mild Child, a "succulent blonde".  The blonde was nice, but it's beginner beer.  The Stout, however, definitely for refined palettes.  Just had some crab dip for dinner.  Was very pleasantly surprised to have a visit from owner/brewmaster Rob, who came to discuss the Stout.  We discussed many different things, and I congratulated him on he, and Candy's success with their venture.  Sitting on the patio was initially a bit warm, but by the time we left, it was a nice night.  Can't get enough of this place!

Great place... my wife and I bring our 1 year old here early evenings.  Fun environment and great food.  The mac and cheese is AWESOME.  Crab dip is really good.  The growler refill deal is good too if you come in semi regularly.   Live music Friday and Saturday at 7pm is nice too!
Great atmosphere and staff! Loved the beer here! I ordered the purplesaurus and it was delicious!

Very pleased with the atmosphere. Beer I had was fantastic and samplers where awesome as well. We also hung out with one of the brewers which was top notch for my boyfriend because he is a home brewer. Can't wait to come back and try the food.
The poutine is awesome and alot of it.  The fish and chips are great as well.  I'm not mutch of a micro-brew person, but they always have one that I like.

We're thrilled to have a locally owned brew pub in the neighborhood!  I'm especially impressed that they source many ingredients from local farmers.  They were a bit slammed the evening we stopped in to try it out - in their defense, it was the night of the art walk in Sunnyslope - so service was a bit slow but understandable given the volume of patrons pouring in the door.   We enjoyed the beer sampler - my fave was the stout!  We decided to share a few dishes - the burger n fries, the brussels sprouts and the crab dip.  All were just delicious!  Looking forward to trying some of the salads offered on the seasonal menu too!  The atmosphere is comfortable, open and very friendly.  We'll be back...with friends!  PS - one wish...Root Beer on tap!

Opening Beer Week Flight Menu:  James Brown Ale (ABV=4.7% / IBUs=29.8) Notes: Pours an amber brown color and as James would say "I feel good.. Whoa!"  Griffin ESB (ABV=5% / IBUs=41.1) Notes: A pretty good opening week beer. Pours a dark cloudy amber. Reminds me of cask ale.  Soiled Dove Dirty Blonde Ale (ABV=4.59% / IBUs=29) Notes: A light beer for me.  Patience Pays Pale Ale (ABV=5.38% / IBUs=33.5) Notes: The only beer with a hint of hops.  Mit Hefe (ABV=5.78% / IBUs=12.1) Notes: A solid cloudy Bavarian Hefewizen.  Finished with a Belguim something poured in a Tulip, I can't remember the name. It will come to me later but for now, I'm Beerly Coherent.  Snacked on the crab dip. This is a decent amount of crab with Ritz crackers. Even tho I dig the old school Ritz, I would prefer a flat, kinda flacky cracker, even saltines. Get a second cracker in the cupboard, Chef Justin. I ran out of crackers so I ordered the German pretzel bread imported and spread the remainder of my lump crab on the bread. The salt over powered the delicate crab a bit but still I was happy, BTW the bread and the three house sauces were damn good.  Next beer name request: "The Sloper"

Love this place! The beer is amazing! I love the Nefarious Dark Belgian Quad! Service is always great and the staff are always happy and attentive. I love hitting it up on a Tuesday night to visit my favorite BT here (Alisa) and enjoy a great brew.
Great place to stop by for a cold local brew and an app. Not wide variety menu but all pretty good.

My honey and I had the weekends to ourselves, which is a rare occurrence and we decided to check this spot out. I've been wanting to see what it's all about for some time now, so we finally decided to head in. I think we picked the perfect night, there was a live band there by the name of KAB I believe, anyway they were amazing and played awesome music. The food was super delicious, I wasn't expecting a place that specializes in brewing beer to also deliver with awesome food. We had the wings, crab dip, and small pizza. My person had 2 beers and I 2 Sangria. The drinks were great, Sangria can be a difficult thing for some places to pull off, and I even liked the beer, my pallet hasn't reached the "beer is awesome" stage yet. Wings were really flavorful, pizza even had some heat, I think they used a rosemary and jalapeno crust, and the crab dip.. well you can't really go wrong with crab dip. It was so good. I also ordered the Brussels sprout salad but our server forgot, and that was a perfect mistake because we were soo full. :)  Another great thing about this place is I saw people from all ages there on Friday Night. The age range was pretty awesome and something you just don't see too much of unless your in some chain restaurant. I saw ages ranging from 5-6 to 60's easy. A lot of young adults ranging 19-26 too. Great Beer, good vibes, awesome music, and delicious food you can't go wrong.

What a great brewery and restaurant! Family owned small craft beer and it's well made. Food is delicious! We had the mountain burger and lumpia for an appetizer, perfectly cooked. Staff were friendly and warm. The restaurant itself is cozy and welcoming. Will definitely come back next time I am in Phoenix.... such a relaxed, cool place.

Meat pizza was very good.  Not a single one of their regular offering beers is above average yet.  Their pazookie ("spent grain cookie") is delicious, but for $8 should be much bigger.  It's about a third of the size of Oregano's pazookie.  Can't wait for the beer to catch up to the food quality.  I've been their twice, and both times the server was refreshingly honest about which beers they thought were subpar.

Great burgers and beer.  We had the best waiters very friendly and new her beer.  She provided free tasting until my wife found found a beer of her liking. The wings are not giant like the menus claims, but we had their house hot sauce and it was very flavorful.  I would've liked it hotter but it was just right for my wife it was delicious and I go back for more
Good beer selection, but most were tapped, good ambiance, food selection, but the service mirrored Rita Pearlman while on the rag. There weren't even crackers for the soup!!!

We went a few weeks ago. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't stellar.   The Banh Mi I ordered was pretty bland, and the burger is overpriced. I had to order the banh mi like 3 times and point to it on the menu because the server said he didn't know what it was. Once he read the decription, he said "oh yeah - that's new but its my favorite thing on the menu." Wait, what?  We ordered a beer flight, and they don't have any of those cool trays that hold the glasses, or even printed placemats that describe each beer, yet. Maybe if they ever firm up the beer selection they will. The flight wasn't bad - but it had a couple of guest brews in substituting for their brews that they were out of.  Since this is the closest brewpub to our house, I had growlers with me. I didn't even walk out to the car to get one. I was hoping for a nice rich porter to fill them with - and they didn't have any that day.  Their saving grace was the Abita Purple Haze on tap. I like Abita beers, but out of all the beers in the flight we tried...I went with the Abita. That's not how it should work at a brewery, unless your guest beer is something like a Pliny or a Stone rarity.
Totally a chill place to hang out and have good beer and food with real people. So glad I found this place in Sunnyslope.

This was one of six breweries I visited on a recent trip to Arizona, and it was an overall pleasant experience. I got a flight of 8 beers (bonus points for large pours) and was able to try the Hoy IPA, Spiral Man stout, James Brown Ale, PT 42 red, Hefe Endings, the Creem Ale, and the Soiled Dove Dirty Blonde.   Overall I enjoyed most of the selection.   The servers seemed a little annoyed with each other and seemed slightly passive aggressive with their conversations; maybe have those talks in the back away from the customers.

Five out of Five forks.   First time here had the poutine. This time around had the surf and turf burger.  Food is amazing. Beer selection is very good.  Enjoyed the CREEM golden ale and the Belay Double IPA.  The IPA is delicious.  Staff is super friendly. Brought a few friends for dinner and we all had a great experience.

4 star category because it met all my expectations. The menu is amazing I wish I had more stomachs to try it all but just enough to have a beer and share the southwest burger I added an egg to that because the combination will make your eyes roll back. The decor is industrial yet cozy . Enough TVs to watch if you want or not. Service was great. I will come back and this says a lot . It's easy to review when you have a bad experience but it's also easy to shout out what's great and what made you feel good. NMB did that for me
Good food, entertainment, lots of beer... loved the brussel sprout salad.  Other food choices were good too.
Only sampled the beer which was great! Sort of a weird location but it's up near the north mountains which made for a pretty drive! Try the baby Belgium it was perfect for a hot afternoon.

This is my 3rd time here. The first visit was on a Sunday afternoon.  The brews were delish and the food was nothing special (ploughmans platter and sampler).  The second visit was after work on a Friday and the service, food (north mountain burger), and beer (Belgian) were great. 5 stars for that night. Tonight, however is a completely different story. My brother in law chose North Mtn for his birthday dinner destination, as he normally has a good experience here. We waited NINETY MINUTES (plus!) for our food. My 'Caesar' salad was literally a plate of lettuce. No croutons (the menu description had croutons listed as an ingredient),  and no Parmesan Romano blend cheese, just a plate of limp romaine with a breast of grilled chicken. We dined with a party of 12, and everyone's entree came out 10 mins apart. When bringing this to the manager's attention, she replied "I'll be right back" and never came back to check that these problems had been corrected. We asked the waiter for some bread (at this point it was 8 pm and out entire group was extremely hungry), and he brought out fried pieces of pita. No butter. No bread. Not even a soft pretzel ( one of the menu items).  All of our water glasses were empty as well. What a waste of time and money! Still waiting for the check too!  We asked for it THIRTY mins ago...

Dined in this evening for my boyfriend's birthday because we're staying at the Hilton down the street and heard great things about this place! Got seated right away and had amazing service. The highlight was the amazing vibe from the live classic rock/country performer!

Delicious shepherds pie and just the right size. The beer flight was awesome and very thankful the waiter offered suggestions. Very relaxed, good food and there was live music which was my favorite part.

I realize that they've only been open a month but I just couldn't overlook many glaring problems at North Mountain Brewing...   First and foremost was the beer selection:  they only had 2 of they're own beers, a Hefeweizen and ESP (both pretty good) and they only had 1 hoppy guest beer.  I'd describe the food menu as bizarre, there are more oyster choices than main dishes or appetizers and the main dishes included things like Poutine and Banger.  My suggestion is to check out their website before you decide to go.  You'll notice something else bizarre - that there's no mention of beer on it.  And you can see for yourself the odd food choices.  One last tip - the lunch menu is much smaller than what's listed on-line.

I just found my new go-to spot for lunch and dinner!  The food here is amazing, and their lumpia is some of the best I have ever had in my life, and I'm Filipino so I know good lumpia when i taste it. They were perfectly crispy, superbly rolled, and served with a delicious thai sauce in addition to the traditional sweet & sour. The grilled cheese and chicken sandwich were also both excellent.  I love IPAs and their Ipacious definitely didn't disappoint. Full of hops, just like I like it, and served in a proper 16 oz pint glass. My only recommendation to the restaurant is to add more IPAs to the lineup because you did such a phenomenal job with the Ipacious. Cheers!

My fianc√© and I visit regularly and are always discovering new favorite brews at North Mountain Brewing Co.! Never pretentious or stuffy, we always enjoy our time seated and served at the bar by the always attentive and personable Anthony. Welcoming, comfortable, and offering consistently great meals and craft beer, North Mountain Brewing Co. is a gem of a place that has found success appealing to anyone and everyone who enters their door. Come as you are and leave vowing to return!

Nice little gem right here. I am usually never ever in this area, but we happened to have a team lunch here and one of the team members suggested it..   Nice littel brewery, with a little asian/filipino theme for food selections. Lumpia .... yumm,,,  ok, Staff were very nice and tentative, I sampled the Octomalt  not too bad a little dry tasting, but decent.. Then I had the Spiral Man a dark oatmeal stout,, yumm, very smooth, could definitly drink a few of these, then close off the drinks, i tried the Baby Belgian, aslo very well flavored nice and mellow..   Food: Asian Sliders, great flavor, and the fried onion strings added a good taste, but the dinner roll /bun as a little on the small / soggy quick side, I am not a huge fan of the pretzel buns since "everyone" uses em now, but over all Was very good..   I would drive a little out of my way to hit this place up.. Friday afternoon lunch.,not over crowded, tables are spaced out so not bumping into people,, Great job guys ,, mabuhay !!

Walked in. Walked out. The waitress actually said "before you look at the menu, let me tell you what beers we don't have." Was very excited to try PT 42. They stopped making it even though it's on their website and in-store menu. They were out of 3 other beers. No ambers or reds. Just one cream. Everything else was pale or hefe. I get that handles rotate, but have some variety. And PT 42 should never be retired.

Almost hidden as it seems like a bike or auto shop from the street. Pretty busy on a week night and the staff was very friendly. Brewery feel and a great atmosphere. Tried the Poutine for the first time. I cant compare it to others but it was pretty good. Would go back again.

I've always had a good experience at NMB, but I visited last night around 8pm and sat at the bar for dinner. The bartender (a woman with short blonde hair) complained the whole time about having to move the beer glasses.  I don't care, I'm there to have a nice time.  She didn't check on whether I needed anything, and did not fill my glass until I literally flagged her down and asked her to do so. As usual the food was good but with service like this I am reluctant to return.

Daughter and I went for lunch, while lunch menu is limited both items we ordered were so good.  I got the pastrami which was so yummy, the fries while I try to stay clear of were very light and tasty.  I absolutely love location, creating new business in older area.  I tried the peach beer on draft, it was yummy.  Service was great, Amber was never far and made she we were good often.
Just happened to drive this place when looking for some grub and it was a very nice surprise.   Great beer, great food, great service.

Overall: For a "gastropub" this place is legit, craft brew with fancy food (healthy options available)  Pros: -all their beer selection is their own craft brew -they have plenty of healthy options -they use local ingredients when possible -the food is really flavorful -great chill ambience -service was great and friendly  Cons: -kitchen closes at 9pm on week nights -they only sell their own craft brew (hopefully this isn't a con)

I am a fan of their beer and the food. My favorite beer they make is the Brown ale.  Another must try is the Saison!  They have a salad made out of brussel sprouts that was amazing.  They sautee it!  I recently had "fried brussel sprout salad at a fancy new Japanese restaurant in Vegas and this was much better. Their mussels are good too.  I also tried the ahi tuna salad which was also very good. I have not gotten around to trying any entrees or sandwiches yet.
This review is for the food.  While taste was good, they greatly overweight the breads, potatoes, and pizza crust, for actual ingredients. Where's the beef??  I would not go back.

We had the lobster dip appetizer, big kids burger, kids cheesy noodles, steak sandwich, and the sausage platter. The ambiance here is great but our kids plates were served 10 minute's before us and then our plates had hot and cold spots. Food was ok, but nothing special.

This place is horrible. The service is so bad and the beer is inconsistent, at least they had some this time. The food was great but I don't know why it took over an hour to get it. Long story short I will not be returning to this place. Whoever owns this establishment should look for a new line of work.

Great brews and really good pub food!  North Mountain Brewing is in an area of the valley we rarely get to.  Luckily, an alumni volunteer event got us to drive to this side of town.  After the event we were looking to try a new spot, in a place we were unfamiliar with, and Yelp pointed us here!  Thank you Yelpers!  We ordered wings and poutine.  The wings were good (house hot sauce wasn't very hot), but the poutine... well... the poutine was sinfully delicious.  Salty, savory, and cheesy.  Oh man, it feels so good to be so bad.  For beer, we ordered the ALTerior Motive, IPAcious, and the Baby Belgian.  Great quality brews with well rounded flavors and some unique flavor profiles.    Service was friendly and timed very well.  They gave great advice about the food and beer.  Check this place out!

Loved this place!!!!!!!! Saw that their was a brewery not to far from my house so I had to go check it out. It's a small location, but a great find. They have beers that they are constantly brewing on site and switching out the menu constantly. I ended up talking to the bartender or a good amount of time and he invited us to the back where one of the brewers gave us a private tour and breakdown on how the beers are brewed, step by step.  If you're a beer enthusiast, like myself, I would suggest checking out the beer flights to get a little taste of everything. One of my personal favorite was the James Brown Ale?i think that was the name.  I really want to come back when they have live music. It was a great experience and I can't wait to go back!

Went to NMB and had to look hard for the entrance but put that aside I really enjoyed their flight of beers especially the lighter ones. Tasty! I had the crab dip, pretzels, and fish 'n chips. Hint of spice in the fish batter! Yummy! Staff friendly. Clean tables and room. I felt very comfortable and was satisfied when I left!

So we also went to the soft-opening.  In that, I'm patient with the service issues which were more than present.  Our 4 dinners were brought out one at a time, about 5-10 minutes apart.  I watched as server after server wandered around the room asking "did you order...?"  My biggest issues here were definitely the problems I don't see them resolving with some simple management.  1. I like beer.  I like craft brews and love microbreweries because you can get something completely new.  Not here. I tried every beer they had on tap, except the one they said wasn't ready yet.  The pale ale was decent, but murky and boring. The hefe had a strong vinegar smell, but luckily tasted a little bit better with a strong banana residual flavor.  The James Brown nut ale had the most character, but at the end of the night, was just a nut brown.  The ESB was boring...little flavor and too dark for the style.  Overall, I enjoyed the guest taps much more.  The Great Divide saison and the Four Peaks black IPA were much more interesting and worth calling craft beers.   2. The food. What a disaster.  I sat with a group of 4.  We ordered their pretzel bread, which I think is just rye bread with pretzel salt on it.  It didn't have much flavor.  The three dips it came with were decent though. I don't eat seafood so the choices for dinner were limited.  There was chicken, burger, bangers and mash, or shepherd's pie.  We ultimately ordered three of these.  Which all came out about 5-10 minutes apart.  The chicken was a drumstick and thigh on about 3/4 cup rice.  VERY salty and mostly just a teriyaki taste. The bangers and mash are one sausage on lumpy mashed potatoes. The shepherd's pie was good, all six bites of it. The burger was forgotten about and reordered.  It came out rare, not medium-well as ordered.  It was ok, but I've had much better burgers that didn't cost $14.  Overall, I would eat before you go, and be willing to know that any beer you get here you can get pretty much anywhere else.  Until they get more creative with beers, and reasonable with thier food prices/portions we will not be going again.    What a shame.

We have been talking about coming to this place for a couple months. We finally went in last night for the first time. From the outside, the restaurant seems nice; however, it's not in the greatest part of town. The inside of the restaurant does not look like a typical brewery. The bar is small for a brewery. We got seated immediately, but it seemed like the service was kind of slow, but very friendly! They have a great selection of beers--the two we tried were really good. The menu is somewhat limited, but that is expected for a brewery. We had the lumpia for an appetizer, despite the funny name, it was really good! We got the bacon grilled cheese and the southwest burger--both great. We definitely plan on being back.

I had a great time tonight with friends!  First time at North Mountain Brewing Co.  Good service, good food and good live music. Not sure who the musican was but amazing flute playing (think jethro tull)! Only reason it's not getting 5 stars is it's a bit loud when you have a large group talking together and the waitress started out letting us know the beer specials were on some wall when you enter the building rather than just telling us or giving a specialty menu. Kinda strange but you easily get past it with their good service and food. Btw had the heffiweisen beer. Yum.

Service here was good.  When we came in it was pasta night and it smelled delicious.  The tasting samplers here are HUGE.  So be prepared if you ordered one of those. In my opinion their brews aren't that great.  Just not my taste.  I also didn't care much for the old timey folk music band they had playing.  I would try this place again, maybe just try a different night and avoid the brews.

I went here with a large group for the hike and brew UYE. The service was really good for having such a large party (around 20 people). They have a large selection of house brewed beers. I tried the hef and it was very tasty. The husband had the cream and enjoyed it very much, it was kind of sweet for a cream and very tasty. We shared the poutine and it was alright, it consisted of thick cut fries (unlike the fries they serve with sandwiches which are thin), cheese curds, gravy, and short rib. The short rib was good and fairly plentiful, it was cooked to the point where it was falling apart... very nice. The overall flavor of the poutine was good, but not the best I had ever had. Despite this, I would get it again. Additionally, it was only 12$ and was plenty of food for 2 people.  I would certainly come here for the beer again in the future.   PS they had amazing sounding desserts.... def want to try that.

This place has potential, but needs a bar rescue. There were maybe 50 customers and at least 11 staff. Most of the staff spent the 90 minutes we were there standing in the corner. The manager is a waste of money. He never left the corner by the POS machine. A few of the beers were good, but a few were horrible. We had to wave down someone to bring us water. The table full of people who arrived 15 minutes after us received their beers before we did. The food was not prepared fresh. Obviously heating frozen food in their pizza oven. I took pictures if the large group of 8 employees who spent the entire evening chatting in the corner.

It is finally great to have a good microbrew and gastropub in north phoenix! We have been here a few times. The beer and food keep getting better. I highly recommend the belagian ale, mighty tasty. We will keep coming back.
First time, great, I mean GREAT beer selection.  I got a 6-glass flight, all were worth a pint.  Lot of tables, lots of parking. We will definitely make this a routine stop.

Wow! What a find. Great food, music and BEER! Loved the beer. Tried the Belay Slave IPA and found it very Hoppy. My wife wanted the N.B.I. but they just ran out and won't have any for 8 to 9 months.  So sad. Had the 3 Strings Porter and liked it.  Food was fantastic.  They had a live band when we arrived that waa great.  So good. Will come back soon.

So, I gave a lone star as My friends and I had a miserable time there 2 weeks ago when we went to check out the new brewery in our hood. I am a beer enthusiast and always try to drink from the local brewers instead of the giants. Atmosphere is really nice, looks clean and real simple set up, a true German style brewery. The service SUCKS! the lady who served us, was least interested in her job nor knew anything about it. It makes me wonder how she passed the interview, or was there one at all?! She offered no description of the beers nor the specials nor the brewery philosophy etc. We had to ask her to tell us about the 6 types of their brew and she told us they are on the board on the wall and we can look it up. We did!  Food was nothing special. The beers were ok I guess (we were so aggravated by the service that didn't care about the beer). We shortly left and had never gone back.  I will give them another try as this may have been a fluke with the crappy server who simply didn't care for the owner nor her job! More review to follow later.

Wish I lived closer to this place! I was totally impressed with the beer selection; so many options! The pretzel bread is a good snack, but the cheese sauce offered as an add-on is nothing special. I liked the mustard and sweet butter dipping sauces though. If you go here, save room for dessert. The fry bread is truly decadent and very addicting: hot, crispy bread pieces smothered in honey with warm beer chocolate for dipping. I split this with three friends, and everyone loved it!
This was a pretty good place, the lumpia was OUTSTANDING and they had a decent selection of mead.

Great pub type atmosphere...meet the brewmaster....nice guy and makes a very good session IPA...wings and Brussels Sprouts ?...friendly and helpful staff...relaxed not too noisy,low key...great craft beer snob type place.    Really worth trying. !

Love the atmosphere. It reminds me of the little gasthauses I always seemed to hang out in Germany. The staff is friendly and I love the beer. They are still working some of the kinks out, but nothing major and I'm sure that with a few more months under their belts it will be a smooth operation. The food is very tasty, but I can't recommend eating here - it is just too expensive.  So to wrap it up, fun, open, inviting place to hang out at and the tables are huge, so invite your friends or better yet make some new friends. Once the food prices/portion sizes are adjusted this could be the go to place. I really hope NMB can make a go of it, the Sunnyslope neighborhood could really use a few more fun spots like this.

Stumbled on to this place by accident, literaly drive by every day and didn't know it was there. Well worth the effort to find parking. All I've had so far is burgers and frys but they were awesome. Dine in once takeout once and both times awesome food. My buddy said beer was excellent as well. Restaurant was nice, clean, and the service was great. Will be a regular from now on.
I love this place! The food is amazing and now it's my ONLY taco Tuesday place. There is a beer for EVERY taste and the employees are all so friendly. Go there and enjoy!

Disappointing evening at NMB.  The beer was not cold enough and when we asked we were told that this was the brewers decision because he felt that being to cold they didn't bring the flavor.   If the beer is warmer than the customer wants or expects, then they are not serving the customer.   The waitress was not well versed in the various beers as we tried the flights.   Very disappointing since I brought out of town guests.   Can't imagine going back anytime soon.

Out of beer?  How does a brewery run out of nearly all of its own beers?  Thank goodness they had a few guest taps, but even then they weren't exactly stellar choices (The Grand Canyon one, yuck).    So I, too, anxiously awaited this place opening but I read the bad reviews of the first few weeks.  I thought it best to give them a month or so to work out any issues.  Well, I'm quite surprised at the beer issue and the rather restricted list of menu items.  One key flaw was that you can't order from a brewpub-appropriate appetizer list in the in-between meal times.  I'm there at 2:30 and my only choices were full portion lunch items.  And not only that, I don't think they're offering enough non-seafood items either.  A lot of people just don't like seafood, and a brewery/brewpub is going to draw a very general crowd of hungry patrons (unlike seafood restaurants per se where it is understood in advance they'll probably just have seafood options).  Parking was very challenging in the back and it's not exactly a nice part of town.  Service was polite.  Food I did receive was fine, but nothing great.  Prices reasonable.  Last and most important though I didn't think their house beers were very good.  But I'm withholding some judgment on this because I was unable to try most of them.

We love this brewery. We started coming here not too long after they first opened and it's been fun to watch all the growth and changes. They have great bartenders who actually know the products they serve. You would think that is normal, but, trust me, it's NOT! This team knows their beers and actually act interested in knowing you are enjoying your drink. The servers are friendly and full of great suggestions for drinks and food. Food...yum! We love all the new and interesting specials and many standards on the menu. The one negative I do have isn't enough to dock a star, but is worth mentioning. Portion size and preparation seems to depend on the chef of the day. For example, we have been served their delicious REAL shepherd's pie in no less than 3 different sizes, all for the same price, all at dinner time. Hmmmmm. But, their burgers are high quality, cooked to order. Their salads are amazing, especially the brussels sprout one. Their pizzas are so good too. Can't go wrong! You will love your experience at North Mountain!

Without having the food I can't comment fully. But the beer is nice. The styles are true to form and decent representations at that. The red ale is quite impressive, has a nice hoppy punch for being a red. The ipa is solid and a nice west coast style. The brown had a good malty tone with some coffee flavor either added or from the toasted malts. The serendipitous Belgian dark was fun, nice and sweet with a good Belgian yeast flavor. All in all pretty impressed with the quality of the beer, they certainly know how to brew and add a little flair to the styles that they make.

As awesome as a brewing company can be. Great beer - I mean it. There wasn't one brew we didn't love. The service - terrific and attentive. Thanks so much!! And the food - the mussels were amazing, the pretzel bread was the best ever. This location has a lot going for it. It's one of those place I don't want people to know about because it'll get too crowded, but I want everyone to know about it because it is so damn good.

Nice place in Sunnyslope that has decent food and brews.  Friendly staff and it's nice to see the area being rejuvenated.  The menu us your basic gastrobrewery fare but still nice.  Local ingredients.  A nice place.

Location is good, they have a lot of parcking space.    Service is good.  Place is clean, though the bathroom has a strong Clorox smell.   The outside sitting is small but it's ok.  The inside set up I don't like.  They have big wood tables so if your party is 2 or 3  people you all have to sit in a table for 6-8.  Plus the tables are set up like a classroom.   The food I have eaten is here:  the pouting fries very small portion for $14, the southwest burger was ok I think it was to flavorless but the thin fries were delish, the nachos not enough of cheese and a oatmeal cookie was delicious except that it was more ice cream than cookie but if they can balance the  cookie  and the ice cream that will be great.  What is great is the beer specially the purplessoures!!!  That's the reason I came back.

Saturday night. 4 adults, 2 kids, 1 teenager. place was busy but we didn't have to wait for a table. Was a little chilly so we opted to sit in the main dining area. They have a small patio and a small private dining room.  I ordered the sangria, hubs ordered the C.R.E.E.M., 1 male flight, 1 female flight and 3 sodas. Alcoholic beverages here get a A+. I love the sangria. It's tart, fruity and sweet.  Food. One very plain burger, 1 cheese only flatbread, 1 grilled cheese with bacon for the kids. One fish and chips, 1 crispy chicken sandwich, 1 shepherd's pie, 1 burger for the adults.  Food took a really long time which would have been ok but they brought ours plates out 1 at a time so it took about 10 minutes from 1st plate to last on our table.  My husbands burger when he took the top bun off looked liked someone had taken a huge bite out of it. He showed the waitress and the manager came over with new one with an apology. My fish was outstanding. The fish was so mild if you didn't get a bite of crispy coating it was just texture in your mouth. Excellent. The chicken sand was huge but looked like shake and bake but cooked nicely, dinig companion ate most of it. Shepherds pie dish was licked clean. All kids cleaned their plates.  Overall No. Mt. is an excellent dining choice. The service always stellar, food always tasty and it's great to meet friends or bring my family.

I was really excited to try this place. It smelled unbelievably good in here like really good barbeque or bacon or something like that. It was all we could do to sit patiently while our table was set up.  Unfortunately that is where the visit turned for the worse. Our server seemed like a nice guy but just couldn't get it together. We ordered some beers and it took well over 10 minutes for him to bring our beers and come back for our order. We asked for some recommendations and took him up on the suggestions. He suggested the Justin brussel sprout salad and stated it was his absolute favorite thing on the menu. So I ordered it and it was mediocre at best. My husband ordered the "pho" which he stated was great...it was literally ramen straight out the package with an egg and a couple veggies. My son ordered the kid's burger. It was like a burnt meatball on a dry bun with no toppings whatsoever. My friend ordered the kale salad which she picked at then turned her nose up at. My other friend ordered the fish and chips but would have been better off "trusting the Gordon's fisherman".   All the poor food aside, the server then left us alone without checking on us throughout our meal. When we finished we asked the guy bussing our table to send him back over so we could order another beer. Our server took our order then hung out with the other servers at the bar/register area for 15 minutes. Eventually we decided to ditch this place to find another that would actually bring us our beers. So I walked up to the register and asked him for our checks and told him to make sure he didnt charge us for the beers he never brought us. He brought us our checks a couple minutes later and mumbled "sorry about that"....   We won't be back.  Edited 04/30/13 at 20:10: To address owner Candy's response below. I am not surprised to see that your professionalism suits your establishment. My review was as honest as I could possibly state it. Your "pho" sucked and it was definitely ramen. I cannot tell you how the kale salad tasted because I did not try it, just stating what I observed of it. As for the back-handed insult stating "I am a mother of 3 kids- if I see a burnt meetball (sic) I would certainly not feed to my children- but I am so surprised you let your son eat it." At no point did I state I allowed my kid to eat it. In fact we stopped after we left your restaurant to get him a different dinner. All the food aside, we most likely would have overlooked the crappy food if the service was better and I would have provided more stars here. I am not sure what you intend by inviting me to "call you to contact me with your honesty". Do you want me to call you at this restaurant? You can email me directly with the best contact info if that is your intention.

My boyfriend and I came here over the weekend while we were in town for Spring Training.   We arrived around 8 pm and it was about 40% full on a Thursday night. They had a cover band playing at a reasonable volume but there is no ambiance music playing when the band takes a break so it does get a little eerily quiet.   It's "family style" seating. So you could be sharing your large table with others. They do have a bar top which you can sit at, and a patio with heaters.  Our server seemed a little lost or new and would disappear at times. We asked for samples of a few of their beers and she gave us the wrong ones. We decided to get the Soiled Dove Dirty Blonde Ale and another one I can't remember. Both were just ok.  Appetizer - we ordered the Lumpia which are little "spring rolls" with pork, veggies and a really good peanut sauce. I believe 8 came with the order. $7  Main Course - North Mountain Burger w/ fries $14  and Fish and Chips $12. The  Fish and Chips didn't taste like they had been sitting in a freezer forever. The tarter sauce wasn't your normal tarter sauce but it was delicious - hints of mustard in it. The food came out quickly and hot. Nothing to rave about but it was good.  I would come here again if it was on my way to my destination or near me, definitely wouldn't seek this place out as my first choice.

I had a great experience here. I drank a dark wheat beer that was delicious, but  I can't recall the name. I ate a Chicago dog that was delicious, but the bun was a tad dry and so were the little hot peppers. The shoestring fries and the pretzel bread with the honey butter was delicious. As you've gathered from reading, this isn't a health spa! There was a lot of other food on the menu that looked like great comfort food items. I will definitely be back to try more.
